column2: Passing the Flames
It is tradition for the Phoenix King to be legitimized by crossing Asuryan's holy flames. If the Prince emerges unscathed, then he is recognized as the rightful ruler of the Asur.
The priestesses make sure you are ready by casting the proper protective spells, and you leap into the flames that will consecrate you as the rightful ruler of Ulthuan.
May Asuryan judge me well.
You emerge unscathed from the holy flames, the priestesses raise their praises to the Gods and the new Phoenix King.
Asuryan blesses me.

You enter the flames with a steady heart, but the Gods do not favour you today. Asuryan's gaze passes through your protective spells and your flesh is scourged with fire. The priestesses manage to recover you, shrieking and maimed, but the will of the Gods has been made clear today, you are not the rightful heir to the Phoenix Crown.
AAAARGH!

You enter the flames with a steady heart, but the Gods do not favour you today. Asuryan's gaze passes through your protective spells and your flesh is scourged with fire. The priestesses struggle to save you, but your offences must have been great indeed, for they recover nothing but a blackened carcass.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has passed through the Flames of Asuryan without being burned, thus proving his divinely-given right to rule over Ulthuan.
Long live the Phoenix King!
What a weird custom.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] tried to pass through the Flames of Asuryan, but the god saw his wickedness and burned him, sculpting a blasphemous shape around a blasphemous heart.
He cannot wear the crown!
He was burned for crossing a fire. So what?
Your [GetFromRelation] was burned by the holy Flames of Asuryan, disgracing his whole line along with himself.
But I'm not tainted!
The healing spells are slowly putting you back to health, but the scourge of Asuryan remains, marking your skin, weighing on your troubled soul.
How could this happen?
[From.GetTitledFirstName] tried to pass through the Flames of Asuryan, but the God saw his wickedness and burned him, leaving nothing but a blackened carcass in his wake.
A false king has been revealed by the righteous gods!
Why did he even cross the fire in the first place?
Your [GetFromRelation] was burned by the holy Flames of Asuryan, dying a horrible death and disgracing his whole bloodline.
But I'm not tainted!
You've been chosen by the Dragon Princes to take the lead of Ulthuan, following the disgraceful reign of [From.GetFirstName].
I will rule in the grace of Asuryan.
Renounce Cadai
Asuryan has cursed you, is it really worth it to worship a God who despises your rule?
Following in the footsteps of the blasphemous Witch-King, [From.GetTitledFirstName] has renounced Asuryan to follow Kaela Mensha Khaine, planting the seeds for a potential second Sundering.
He is right!
Shame befalls him.
The Dragon Princes have decided that it is in the best interest of Ulthuan that its rule pass to [From.GetFirstName] after the ignominious departure of the last Phoenix King.
But I'm the rightful heir!
Some Elves believe the Asur should detach themselves from the corruption of the outside world, others that it is their duty to lead lesser species away from evil.
We need to protect Ulthuan.
We need to protect the World.
Take a political stance
Every Elf in Ulthuan has their personal opinion about whether Asur should involve themselves in the affairs of the outside world or not. What's yours?
Isolationists
Isolationists

It is common in Ulthuan for Elves to preach detachment from the rest of the world, to prevent corruption from pouring in. Going against this traditional way of thinking is not well regarded by some Princes.
Demand liege to close borders
Ulthuan should not meddle with other lesser cultures. It is time for the Phoenix King to accept that.

I am afraid the Faction I represent must insist on changing the current political stance of Ulthuan regarding the outside world. We are fully prepared to take up arms should you refuse, and rest assured, we have warriors enough to enforce our just demand and finally guarantee the safety and purity of the blood of Asur...

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
Very well.
This is not what I command!

Your shameful attempt at blackmail has not succeeded. No matter how many corrupted souls you have enticed to help carry out your plan I will not give in without a fight. Ulthuan has been secluded for far too long!

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
Then war it is!

I see the error of my ways and understand now what is best for the Asur. I will issue a formal declaration disallowing further interaction with the outside world.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
Excellent.

Rather than letting civil war tear the realm apart, [From.GetTitledName] has agreed to change [From.GetHerHis] stance on external politics. Your valuable support in this conflict will not be forgotten.

Sincerely,
[FromFrom.GetTitledName]
Good.
[From.GetTitledName] has agreed to the demands of the Isolationist Party.
I see...
§Y$CLAIMANT$§! can declare war to close the borders of Ulthuan
Change Isolationist Policy
$ORDER$$SECOND_ADJ$ Civil War to change isolationist policy
Interventionists
Interventionists
Some in Ulthuan agree it is the sacred duty of the Asur, as the superior race, to act as guardians and protectors to the lesser races, and keep the world safe from corruption.
Demand liege to open borders
Ulthuan should not cower away from the world, hopelessly leaving the other races to their own limited means. It is time for the Phoenix King to accept that.

I am afraid the Faction I represent must insist on changing the current political stance of Ulthuan regarding the outside world. We are fully prepared to take up arms should you refuse, and rest assured, we have warriors enough to enforce our just demand and finally lead Ulthuan beyond of this obnoxious stagnation.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
Very well.
This is not what I command!

Your shameful attempt at blackmail has not succeeded. No matter how many corrupted souls you have enticed to help carry out your plan I will not give in without a fight. Ulthuan needs not to meddle in the affairs of shortlived barbarians!

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
Then war it is!

I see the error of my ways and understand now what is best for the Asur. I will issue a formal declaration allowing interactions with the outside world.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
Excellent.

Rather than letting civil war tear the realm apart, [From.GetTitledName] has agreed to change [From.GetHerHis] stance on external politics. Your valuable support in this conflict will not be forgotten.

Sincerely,
[FromFrom.GetTitledName]
Good.
[From.GetTitledName] has agreed to the demands of the Interventionist Party.
I see...
Change political stand
As Phoenix King, you are allowed to switch the foreign policy of Ulthuan depending on your preference.
Ulthuan no longer recognizes the pleas of the outside world, giving paramount importance to the prosperity of the Asur over all.
Ok.
Ulthuan recognizes its role as the sole protector of the whole world.
Ok.

§Y$CLAIMANT$§! can declare war to colonize new lands outside of Ulthuan, ridding them of corrupt or otherwise barbaric influences. Colonies increase Elven influence over the world, but can be expensive to maintain.
Asur Colonization of [Title.GetBaseName]
$ORDER$$SECOND_ADJ$ Elven Colonization of $OTHER_TITLE$
Now that the land has been freed from uncivilized indigenous barbarians, it can be assigned to a proper well-bred elven legate who will oversee its colonization.
Excellent.
Donation to Ulthuan
This colony has recently given tribute to Ulthuan.
Funded Colony
Abandoned Colony
Paid for Colony
Colonial Tribute
Withheld Tribute
Asked Assistance
§Y$CLAIMANT$§! can declare war to expand the Asur's influence in foreign lands, ridding them of corrupt or otherwise barbaric influences.
Asur Colonization of [Title.GetBaseName]
$ORDER$$SECOND_ADJ$ Elven Colonization of $OTHER_TITLE$
The appointed ruler of your newly acquired land abroad has sent word that [From.GetSheHe] needs funds to start the project of colonization.
I will pay for it myself.
All the Princes of Ulthuan should contribute.
We cannot spare the resources.
As is customary, the Phoenix King has sent troops and resources to help start up the colonization process.
Excellent.
The Phoenix King has issued a special tax to fund the effort of Asur colonization abroad.
I'll gladly pay it.
Unspeakable waste!
Sadly, Ulthuan cannot spare resources to forward to your colony right now.
Did they abandon us?
One of your colonies has reported a great victory for the Asur. As customary, they've sent a tribute containing a share of their spoils.
I'll take them.
All the Princes of Ulthuan who supported them should take a share.
News has reached you one of Ulthuan's colonies reported a great victory. Even so, the Phoenix King withheld any profits of this success from the Dragon Princes.
How dare [From.GetSheHe]!
News has reached you one of Ulthuan's colonies reported a great victory. The Phoenix King has sent part of the profits to all those who supported Elven intervention outside Ulthuan.
Sublime.
I suppose it's fair...
[From.GetTitledFirstName], owner of one of your colonies, has sent a large tribute to Ulthuan to confirm [From.GetHerHis] staunch dedication to the Crown.
We graciously accept this tribute for ourselves.
We shall share this tribute with all the Princes who support us.
News has reached you one of Ulthuan's colonies sent a large tribute to Ulthuan, but the Phoenix King seems to have withheld it all for [From.GetHerHim]self.
How dare [From.GetSheHe]!
News has reached you one of Ulthuan's colonies reported a great victory. The Phoenix King has sent part of the profits to all those who supported Elven intervention outside Ulthuan.
Sublime.
I suppose it's fair...
Donate to Ulthuan
Give a share of your profits to the ancestral homeland, so that the Phoenix King may look kindly upon you in your time of need.
Colonial War
Helped Colony
[From.GetTitledFirstName] sends a call for help to Ulthuan, for the Phoenix King to aid [From.GetHerHis] colony in its time of need.
Ulthuan will join our brethren and fight alongside them!
I will fund the colony's effort on my own.
All the Princes shall provide help for our brethren abroad.
We cannot spare any resources right now.
Ulthuan has answered your call for help, sending resources and soldiers to aid you in your time of need.
Excellent.
One of Ulthuan's colonies is entangled in a war with an uncivilized race. The Phoenix King has issued a special tax to help it in its struggle.
I'll gladly pay it.
Unspeakable waste!
The Phoenix King has decided it is not in the best interests of the Asur to aid you right now.
Did they abandon us?
One of Ulthuan's colonies is entangled in a war with an uncivilized race. The Phoenix King has declared to mobilize the entire Kingdom to help them.
Let us march with them!
Outrageous!
Quell your fears, for the Phoenix King has heard your call and all of Ulthuan shall come to aid you against your enemies.
Praise the Gods!
Call Ulthuan
As an Asuryan colony, you can plead the Phoenix King for help in any war against barbarians you find yourself entangled in.
Enforced Policy

A princely coalition has recently forced the Phoenix King to change Ulthuan's foreign policy. It would be unlikely for any noble to touch the issue for a while, for fear of destabilizing Ulthuan too much.
Help Colony
You can assist your brethren abroad by joining in their struggles against lesser race.
An Ulthuan Prince has decided to join your wars.
Excellent.
Ignored Colony
Forced Policy
Plea to Ulthuan
Ulthuan's borders are currently closed. A generous donation from a legitimate source could perhaps change the Phoenix King's mind?
A colony of Asur has sent a bountiful donation to Ulthuan, along with esteemed messengers pleading Ulthuan to re-open its borders to the Asur abroad.
We accept this donation with an open mind and open gates.
I'm afraid this still won't do.
Opened Borders
The messengers return with an envoy from Ulthuan: the Phoenix Prince was moved by your plea and has decided to reopen Ulthuan's shores.
Finally!
Sadly, Ulthuan does not feel the world is worth saving, despite your efforts to convince them otherwise.
What about my boatload of treasure?
Restore Everqueen
Avelorn is traditionally held by the holy Everqueen. As the Phoenix King you can force the current holder to relinquish it back to its rightful owner.
Refused Debate
Debated
Recently Debated
Declined Debate
Recent Debate Victory
This character has recently won a fiery political debate.

[FromFrom.GetFirstName] has already voiced openly [FromFrom.GetHerHis] opinions, at odds with your own, about Ulthuan's best interest, but [FromFrom.GetSheHe] has now decided to publicly challenge you to a debate to defend your argument about foreign policy.
You'll see the reason of my arguments.
I have nothing to tell you.
[From.GetFirstName] has agreed to your challenge and will debate you with a jury of peers to determine the validity of the arguments of both parties.
I will prevail.
The coward, [From.GetFirstName], has chosen to dismiss your arguments without a proper comeback and is refusing to debate you.
Of course, [From.GetSheHe] knows [From.GetSheHe]'s wrong.

The noble and a very select crowd of Asur reunites in the public square to hear your case against interventionist policies and the comeback of your opponent. You spend hours going back and forth, going through hot topics and exchanging sharp questions about Ulthuan's future. In the end your opponent starts faltering, you press the validity of your position, putting forth arguments over the Sundering and on the ungratefulness of the lesser races. Both the crowd and your opponent finally recognize your stance as the more logical.

The noble and a very select crowd of Asur reunites in the public square to hear your case against isolationist policies and the comeback of your opponent. You spend hours going back and forth, going through hot topics and exchanging sharp questions about Ulthuan's future. In the end your opponent starts faltering, you press the validity of your position, putting forth arguments over the growing threats in the North and the burden of the High Elf. Both the crowd and your opponent finally recognize your stance as the more logical.

The noble and a very select crowd of Asur reunites in the public square to hear you defend the isolationist policy against your opponent. You spend hours going back and forth, going through hot topics and exchanging sharp questions about Ulthuan's future. In the end your opponent starts faltering, you press the validity of your position, putting forth arguments over the Sundering and on the ungratefulness of the lesser races. Both the crowd and your opponent finally recognize your stance as the more logical.

The noble and a very select crowd of Asur reunites in the public square to hear you defend the interventionist policy against your opponent.You spend hours going back and forth, going through hot topics and exchanging sharp questions about Ulthuan's future. In the end your opponent starts faltering, you press the validity of your position, putting forth arguments over the growing threats in the North and the burden of the High Elf. Both the crowd and your opponent finally recognize your stance as the more logical.
The truth prevails.

The noble and a very select crowd of Asur reunites in the public square to hear your case against interventionist policies and the comeback of your opponent. You spend hours going back and forth, going through hot topics and exchanging sharp questions about Ulthuan's future. Yet, in the end, you start seeing the validity of many points made by your adversary. You have no arguments left to counter your opponent's and are forced to agree Ulthuan would benefit from closing its borders to the lesser races.

The noble and a very select crowd of Asur reunites in the public square to hear your case against isolationist policies and the comeback of your opponent. You spend hours going back and forth, going through hot topics and exchanging sharp questions about Ulthuan's future.  Yet, in the end, you start seeing the validity of many points made by your adversary. You have no arguments left to counter your opponent's and are forced to agree Ulthuan would benefit from being more invested in the outside world.
Was I wrong all along?

The noble and a very select crowd of Asur reunites in the public square to hear your case against interventionist policies and the comeback of your opponent. You spend hours going back and forth, going through hot topics and exchanging sharp questions about Ulthuan's future. The sun goes down, some in the public start to go back to their homes, yet no consensus has been reached. By the time dawn comes, the only thing you and your opponent can agree on is how much you despise each other.

The noble and a very select crowd of Asur reunites in the public square to hear your case against isolationist policies and the comeback of your opponent. You spend hours going back and forth, going through hot topics and exchanging sharp questions about Ulthuan's future. The sun goes down, some in the public start to go back to their homes, yet no consensus has been reached. By the time dawn comes, the only thing you and your opponent can agree on is how much you despise each other.
How can you be SO stubborn!?!
Has not recently debated
Debate
Asur nobles are used to endlessly debating over the vital role Ulthuan should have in the grand scheme of things.
Has not recently won a debate
Public Debate
Refused Debate Result
This character was soundly defeated in a public debate but, rather than accepting defeat, clung irrationally to their beliefs.
No, I can't be wrong! You lie!
Despite being soundly defeated, your opponent still refuses to accept the reality of Ulthuan.
Pathetic...
Pretenders!

You've always prized your impeccable poetic skills. Yet, as of late, you've had more and more trouble with inspiration. It's so hard to think of something meaningful any more, it seems like all the greatest, most sublime topics have already been exhausted by Ulthuan's long list of esteemed composers.

You've always prized your impeccable poetic skills. Yet, as of late, you've had more and more trouble with inspiration. The dreaded fear and cold sophistication of Druchii architecture and the damp forests of Naggaroth can only be applied for so long after all...
Maybe I could try taking... something... to enhance my point of view?
It is said suffering helps the poet...
I'm sure I'll find something, eventually.

It's not easy to find certain philtres in Ulthuan, but alchemists have to use all sorts of reagents for their experiments. In the end you were able to find and make use of what you needed. The thrill itself was enough to tingle your senses, but the experience right after was something indescribable.

The New World is filled with strange plants and fungi used for certain rituals, it didn't take long for you to find what you needed. In the end you were able to find and make use of what you needed. The thrill itself was enough to tingle your senses, but the experience right after was something indescribable.
I can touch the Winds of Magic!

You spend sometime wondering the moral ramifications of your action, but in the end, you agree with yourself it can be an enriching experience. As you observe life slowly dripping away from your wrists, you experience an unfathomable new sensation. When you finally press the wound closed, what you've lost in blood, you've gained tenfold in inspiration.

It's not something unheard of amongst Khaine followers after all. As you observe life slowly dripping away from your wrists, you experience an unfathomable new sensation. When you finally press the wound closed, what you've lost in blood, you've gained tenfold in inspiration.
What if I used it instead of ink? How deep!

You can see the hordes of daemonic hordes riding over your fingers. They are so distinct... Yet they're fading away already, you need more of the substance. You can't come unprepared when they come back.
They're still on my hand!
You could have touched the heavenly figure, it was right in front of you, so alluring... Yet now she has disappeared, you need more of the substance. Reality has become so dull.
Where's my dust?
You pick a fruit from the heavenly garden, yet, when put it between your lips it turns into your finger. The effects are fading again, you need more of the substance. Reality has become so dull.
Where did I leave it?
Your multiple experiences really opened your mind, you can see things in such a broad spectrum. As long as you take more of the substance.
Yes, yes, I see all now.
It took you a while to notice, but as got out of your drug-induced trance, you glanced at the servant peeling from the curtains, spying on you.
He can join me, there's enough of it for two.
Want to see something? *Grab him*
Maybe it's time to stop with this...

The servant appears scared at first, but once you force him to inhale some of your ailment, he calms himself, happily joining you. The experience is even better with someone else, maybe you should convince more people to join in the future...
Yes, just let your mind roam...
[Root.GetFirstName] unlocked the targeted decision 'Twist'.
You drag the servant across the floor and press his face into your last bag of dust, leaving him shaking and choking. After some time, he finally stops, dead.
How do you like that? What is your *soul* seeing?

Each day you give thanks for the inspiration that has led you thus far but although you still feel the thrill when pain dances across your flesh, as time goes on you long to feel something even harsher. As you wonder this things, you find yourself soothed by the chirping of a lovely songbird scampering near your window. For a while you simply delight in its song but eventually your thoughts begin to turn and you start to wonder if perhaps you could inspire it to even greater heights of artistry. How much more beautiful and moving would it be if he went to the same suffering as you subordinate yourself to...
I must know!
That's base, I'll cleanse this thought from my flesh!
That's enough, never again.

It's growing faint so quickly, but you cannot deny the unique and sublime tone given to birds' notes. It might have been its last song, but you're brought to tears by that very perfection you helped it reach.
It was... enchanting...

You start punishing your own flesh, but as you go on, you start seeing the art of your work, the passion inside every cut. You quickly grab a mirror and start drawing red lines over your face, ecstatic at the sight of your coming masterpiece.
Sublime!

Your scholarly studies give you plenty of time for peaceful contemplation and the enjoyment of solitude. All alone in the great library, you cannot fail to think of the books as little universes, hanging to your whims, depending on your care.
A slight change here or there, and history itself is rewritten!
Like the world, they could have little daemons roaming inside...
They should always be preserved at their best.
You smirk, complimenting yourself on your work and passing to the next volume. So many great deeds were committed by your ancestors you didn't know about...
It's like bending time itself!

Another little miniature is ready and you move to look for a good spot for the next one. They are so well hidden. The future generations will look at the marvels of these pages and ignore the obscenities laughing at them from the paper.
It's so delightful!

Your days of quiet enjoyment seems to have come to an end. A young apprentice has come to the library to study. A pompous, nagging little brat, asking you for directions every hour, giving you sleazy looks every time he thinks you're not watching him.

Your days of quiet enjoyment seems to have come to an end. A young apprentice has come to the library to study. A pretentious, nagging little brat, asking you for directions every hour, outrageously flirting as if her very presence was a gift to you.
It's a vast and ancient library one could easily get lost in...
Let's see if the brat can really handle what it craves for...
Walking close to the staircase, I see? Hmm...
I'll just have to bear with it.

Who knows when the poor student is getting out of the old storage room. It's so dark and twisted, how could the brat even end there, you wonder? Here's to hoping the poor soul doesn't get eaten by rats. On the other hand, his muffled screams for help are so soothing...
It sounds like a lullaby.

It wasn't so bad. The boy turned out to be experienced at least in something. And going rough with him assured you some days of quiet in the future. You couldn't deny you enjoyed having the chance to choke the little brat, if only for a while.

It wasn't so bad. The girl turned out to be experienced at least in something. And going rough with her assured you some days of quiet in the future. You couldn't deny you enjoyed having the chance to choke the little brat, if only for a while.
A teacher *should* spank their students from time to time...
It takes just one little trip. You have to bear the squealing voice of the annoying twerp only up to when the brat's head squashes on the floor below.
What a beautiful silence. Poetic.

You were doing some testing for a new concoction in your laboratory, but something has gone wrong. The rat you used for your experiment has started to slowly and painfully choke after tasting the substance.
This needs to be closely observed, yes...
I'll check on it later, let's try something else first.
Better to end the poor creature's suffering.

Despite your careful examination, you cannot find the source of the problem. You have to admit to yourself though, watching the creature gasping for its last breath from above, like a passive deity, filled you with a smug sense of satisfaction.
It just comes with the job.

When you return with a new mix, you find out the rat has not yet drawn its last breath. You have it ingest the new substance and while the creature dies, there's a series of fascinating side-effects accompanying its death.
How interesting. I'll need another rat.

You really looked forward the visit of your distant colleague, you'd had a thrilling correspondence in the last months. Yet, now that you have him here, you are starting to seriously question your judgement. The short-sighted fool is dismissing many of your accomplishments, accusing you of using experiments just as a pretence to kill and torture your test subjects. He has even started to threaten you to call authorities to have you answer of some of these supposed transgressions.
Your brain doesn't work. Let me check it.
Allow me then to show you this great brew I tested on rats some time ago...
Maybe he's right?

Your colleague finally stops twitching. Some more stitches and he'll be free to go. Of course he was belittling you, the lymph determining his pride and envy were cluttering his brain, you had to remove an entire piece to cure him.
Ssshhh, it's all over now.

There's no real difference. Like the rat, the scholar can only look at you from below now, in awe and terror, as he chokes on his own blood. The post-mortem reactions seem to be considerably different from your last tests with rats.
I should try it with more people then...

Since your youth you've been admired for your intelligence. Yet, at the same time, when you've put it into practice, you've always had people complain and snort, opting for the most stupid of decisions. Like the minor noble in front of you right now, bragging about his mediocre accomplishments and calling your wisdom cowardice and self-entitlement. Why gifted people such as you should suffer idiots of his sort?
If you so desire, I'll humiliate you right now in front of everyone.
Speak on, I'll speak later, to the right people.
If I answered in kind, I'd be as stupid as he is.

When you're finished with him, the courtier is so ashamed he cannot spit a word back. As if it wasn't enough recounting his many failings, you inflame the court against him and he's soon driven out by shouts and threats.
See?

Seeing you not answering him, the courtier keeps on bragging, finally leaving the room when satisfied with his work. In a few days you send your people to the countryside, spreading enough vicious rumours to utterly destroy his reputation, while at the same time maintaining yours.
That's where the genius lies.

The events at court in the last weeks still haunt you. The thrill, the satisfaction of having the entire court hanging from your lips, then pitted against that insufferable idiot... It wouldn't be bad to feel it again.
There's plenty of fools, it's only a question of time.
No, it's not warranted.

You are about to send another peasant off to his ironic and well fitted punishment, when one of your spies comes whispering into your ears the bragging courtier is dead by his own hand. He committed suicide to escape the shame.
Ah! Thus proving once more what a fool he was!

You've always had a sweet tooth and enjoyed foods of all sorts, filling your belly with exotic delicacies gives you an indescribable sense of satisfaction. Yet many at court frown on your taste as inappropriate for an Elven noblewoman.

You've always had a sweet tooth and enjoyed foods of all sorts, filling your belly with exotic delicacies gives you an indescribable sense of satisfaction. Yet many at court frown on your taste as inappropriate for an Elven nobleman.

You've always exercised caution and moderation in your meals, as befitting an Elven noblewoman, yet sometimes it's really hard to say no to some new delicacy, have your stomach growl and be content with roots and vegetables.

You've always exercised caution and moderation in your meals, as befitting an Elven nobleman, yet sometimes it's really hard to say no to some new delicacy, have your stomach growl and be content with roots and vegetables.
Nobody can deny you enjoy a good celebration every once in a while. The thing is, as of late, nothing seems to excite you anymore. After years of experience, it seems you're out of ideas...
They're wrong, I don't care!
Maybe I could use a little moderation...
A little indulgence won't hurt...
No, I'm committed.
Or maybe not... Just need to dig *deeper*...
Well, that happens when you live for centuries...
Why did you even doubt yourself? This is the way you like spending your life. Why negate some simple pleasure to try and reach the unattainable ideal of Elven beauty?
They are just bones wrapped in judgemental skin.
Having to let yourself go for a while was nice and all, but now you worry if you're not overdoing with all the large meals.
Just one more snack...

Your wild feast seems a success, there's all sort of grotesque entertainment going on, things to make an Asur blush. You're having the time of your life, when some stupid page has the gall to voice his absolute repulsion for the whole spectacle, calling your guests weakling sycophants and you a depraved vixen with no shame, as if being the only one in the room to be still dressed gave him more nobility than the one in your blood.

Your wild feast seems a success, there's all sort of grotesque entertainment going on, things to make an Asur blush. You're having the time of your life, when some stupid page has the gall to voice his absolute repulsion for the whole spectacle, calling your guests weakling sycophants and you a libidinous pervert with no shame, as if being the only one in the room to be still dressed gave him more nobility than the one in your blood.
Pile on him! Pile on him!
Maybe we've gone a tad bit too far...

When you wake up in the morning in the garden, naked and wrapped around in a fur cloak by the statue of an Elven God-like, you can barely remember what exactly happened the night before. One thing was clear: it was awesome.
And whatever happened to that servant?

Ignoring the courtiers' prattling seemed to quell your conscience for some time, yet now you are starting to notice how less and less dresses fit you and how tiring moving has become. You can barely fit your behind on the throne any more.
I don't mind, it's all so good!
What am I becoming? Enough of this!
Why others even care so much? Should you starve yourself like a peasant? They're only envious of you, that's all, they know what they're missing out. Maybe you should show them, some time...
Why not?
The Gods teach moderation and abstinence, but you've always had trouble with it. Is it so wrong to lay down for a while and enjoy a good glass of wine with some friends? Or a barrel of mead?
Khaine is not soft on weakness, but you've always had trouble with it. Is it so wrong to lay down for a while and enjoy a good glass of wine with some friends? Or a barrel of mead?

You've always followed the austere dictates of the Gods, always kept your mind clear to better fight corruption and Chaos. Yet, sometimes you envy the simple joys of inebriation and carousing. Would it be so wrong to give into it once in a while?

You've never let your guard down and kept your mind clear and sharp to fight your enemies. Yet, sometimes you envy the simple joys of inebriation and carousing. Would it be so wrong to give into it once in a while?
Nobody can deny you enjoy a good celebration every once in a while. The thing is, as of late, nothing seems to excite you anymore. After years of experience, it seems you're out of ideas...
I'll drink to that.
Maybe I should spend more time sober...
A little sip won't really hurt...
Doesn't matter. Can't afford to risk.
Or maybe not... Just need to dig *deeper*...
Well, the desensitization comes when you live for centuries...

Why worry about the Gods? Surely they drink too from time to time. You remember seeing a statue of one holding a bottle. Or did you put it there one of your nights out? The memory is blurry right now...
If it fitted, it means *he* wanted it!
Since you started drinking, every night is a party, things normally so bland, suddenly become hilarious through the alcohol induced stupor. How could you miss all this for so long?
Ah ah!

Your wild feast seems a success, there's all sort of grotesque entertainment going on, things to make an Asur blush. You're having the time of your life, when some stupid page has the gall to voice his absolute repulsion for the whole spectacle, calling your guests weakling sycophants and you a depraved vixen with no shame, as if being the only one in the room to be still dressed gave him more nobility than the one in your blood.

Your wild feast seems a success, there's all sort of grotesque entertainment going on, things to make an Asur blush. You're having the time of your life, when some stupid page has the gall to voice his absolute repulsion for the whole spectacle, calling your guests weakling sycophants and you a libidinous pervert with no shame, as if being the only one in the room to be still dressed gave him more nobility than the one in your blood.
Pile on him! Pile on him!
Maybe we've gone a tiny winy too far...

When you wake up in the morning in the garden, naked and wrapped in a fur cloak by the statue of an Elven God-like, you can barely remember what exactly happened the night before. One thing was clear: it was awesome.
And whatever happened to that servant?
As a mockery from the Gods themselves, the sense of inebriation has started to fade in the last days. Doesn't matter how much you drink, you can only get so little enjoyment from it.
Time to move to something stronger than alcohol.
It's probably a sign of mercy. Enough of this.

You were right, alcohol was just the tip of a great new universe of sensation you've unlocked. There are so many substances, so many ways to see the world... And those narrow-minded fools see it as weakness?
I could show them...

Asur frown upon the weak temptation of the flesh, yet you've always had a hard time adhering to this principle. Even worst, recently nothing seems to satisfy your lust anymore. Luckily a bard that has recently come to your court gave you a good impression he could help.

Asur frown upon the weak temptation of the flesh, yet you've always had a hard time adhering to this principle. Even worst, recently nothing seems to satisfy your lust anymore. Luckily a bard that has recently come to your court gave you a good impression he could help.
Druchii women aren't exactly known for their modesty and you are no exception. Yet your lust has run somewhat dry in the last years, nothing seems to enflame it anymore.

Druchii don't mind employing all of their skills to get the favour of a Sorceress or some other Matriarch, that doesn't mean one should not enjoy the process of getting it. Sadly, as of late, you've had a hard time satisfying your lust.
You've always been praised by other Asur for your modesty and for how gracefully you've protected your virtue. Yet, from time to time, you have... yearnings.

You've always been praised by other Asur for your clear-mindedness and for how gracefully and respectfully you've treated the opposite sex. Yet, from time to time you wonder how could it be to act as some lesser kins do...
Druchii women aren't exactly known for their modesty, your prudish tendencies have always been derided amongst your peers. How could sex ever help a woman in social climbing anyway?

You've always just wanted to mind your own plots and raids, yet you have Witches and Sorceresses of all kinds walking around half-naked day in day out. How is someone to keep his head clear and plan anything in these conditions?
I could try a stronger approach.
The fire will return, eventually.
Maybe I could try something more... unorthodox? Just once?
I... no, no, no, I just can't.
You push the young man on the floor, sinking your nails into his skin and twisting his arm. The woman joins you with a whip, trying to catch you off guard, but you take her wrist in time.
You push the young woman on the floor, sinking your nails into his skin and twisting his arm. The man joins you with a whip, trying to catch you off guard, but you take her wrist in time.
Give it to me!
That's enough for today.

You lick the blood off your hands, wrapped around the two young quivering mates. You weren't so sure at the beginning, but now all sorts of nice ideas are coming to your mind for the next sessions, you've been really missing out on something...
Maybe I'll pick someone else, too.
The young man straps you tighter to the bed, spitting on you and glancing at the tools to see what to use next.
The young woman straps you tighter to the bed, spitting on you and glancing at the tools to see what to use next.
Yes! Yes, tell me how I deserve this!
That's too much, stop!

Once the traveller leaves you tied up in the bed, you are exhausted, but at the same time, you still yearn for more. There must be other interesting ways to experience what you did, you could make some research.
Yes, very deep research.

You are rightfully and justly feared by your servants and vassals alike, as proper Druchii highborn should. You are just wondering how more enjoyment did you find in exacting your punishments when a servants trips you by accident.

Several at court seem to dislike your harsh methods. You are just wondering how more enjoyment did you find in exacting your punishments when a courtier dares to speak against your final verdict on a peasant.
You never really liked violence, much to the ridicule of your Druchii peers. When a farmer you just pardoned ends up in court again for stealing and pleads to you, you start seeing their point.

You've always kept true to the Gods and exerted kindness and good judgement in your actions. Yet, sometimes, the stupidity of your servants, the mockery of your courtiers, they really push you to edge.
You miserable wretch!
You know what? He's beneath me.
That's it! Now you're getting it!
Patience, patience...

The courtier cries for forgiveness at every lash, but you still feel like he's not had enough. Exacting the punishment by yourself, without the jailer, makes it feel so much more intimate and satisfying.

The servant cries for forgiveness at every lash, but you still feel like he's not had enough. Exacting the punishment by yourself, without the jailer, makes it feel so much more intimate and satisfying.
You think it's over? We're just getting started here.
I think you've learned your lesson.
You emerge the dungeon soaked in blood and with a heavy breath. The new prisoner is not getting out for some time. The wonders you did to him... It was almost artistic.
We need to do this more often.

You have the farmer flogged on the public square. He almost looked surprised at your verdict, probably he hoped to get free again. Not anymore. And besides, watching the executioner rip the flesh from his back is so gratifying...
The maiden deserved that punishment, she was clumsy and irresponsible. It was so gratifying and just to give to her her rightful punishment.
It's your fault! You brought this upon yourself.
I'm so sorry, I don't know what came to me!
Each wound... Is like a painting celebrating justice, it's almost inebriating. Kindness doesn't mean foolishness after all. One needs to be harsh to be loving.
Indeed.
Having to ride out or even walk after eating so much always makes you nauseous. You had also planned a fencing session today, but perhaps you should take a break...
I'm not feeling like doing anything right now.
Wouldn't be healthy do nothing after eating so much.
You were planning for a walk after the sixth course, but you're feeling too heavy and tired to walk anywhere right now.
Your whole life is a failure, there is really no point in doing anything if it's always going to be the wrong thing.
Better do nothing at all.
I have to try, at least.
Why even get up of bed when everything and everyone is going to be against you, each day of your accursed life? You might as well lay down and wait for death.

Every night is a party, things normally so bland, suddenly become hilarious through the alcohol induced stupor I'm keeping myself into. Despite a few rough mornings, I can barely remember the last time I was sad.
Life is good.
Yeah, but I can barely remember *anything* at all...

Another day passes by, spent sitting on my nice soft couch and gorging upon the last delicacies of my cooks. Everything would be fine, if not because I'll have to skip second breakfast tomorrow morning to let the tailor take again my measures for new clothes. Perhaps I can make the servants feed me while he works...
He better take them good this time.

I've lost every appetite. I do nothing, why should I eat anything? I'm not hungry anyway. My body has grown skinnier and sharper as days passed by, even the faintest of the noises and lights bothers me and I find harder to focus for longer times.
Am I dreaming right now?
I know the value of good work and moderation, yet my body is still cursed by past wickedness.
I must try to get back into shape, no matter what.
I've really a lot to worry about already.

The rush of appetite I've been having lately has truly been good to me: I feel less tired, everyone at court says I look healthier and my bones do not stick out anymore from under my skin. I do worry about overdoing though...
Nonsense!
Maybe it's better to return to more frugal habits...
You've discovered new depths of pleasure that most people can only dream of. Why not bestow your knowledge to others as well? You've gained the 'Twist' targeted decision.
Magnificent.
Your helmet falls off and the enemy's blade strikes true. When you come to your senses again, your whole face has been covered in bandages, covering a ghastly disfigurement.
My face!

Lately your sour humour has brought you to contemplate your delicate features, the ones bards used to sing about in your halls. Nothing brings you comfort, your life is an unending cycle of suffering... Nothing good ever happens to you, why then you have such a pretty face? As you look at your reflection, you realize you have a blade in your hands.
The blade carves deep in your skin, peeling off slices of flesh, taking away your undeserved beauty, painting you of the dark colours of your soul.

In the past few days you thought back to how close you came to disfigure yourself over nothing. The shock has somehow awaken you. Why should you keep living like this any longer? Don't you have suffered enough without beating yourself too? Maybe a more sunny disposition could be what you really need.

You weren't even brave enough to rightfully punish yourself for your beauty. Now your untarnished face haunts you in every corner, reminding of your undeserving looks. Today it was once too much and to escape the guilt you ended up jumping off a balcony. Your servants managed to get you healed in time sadly, but you are permanently crippled.
I don't deserve this.
Is this really what I'm reduced to?
The pain is my friend, the pain is good...
I shall not fall so low again.
I deserve this.
Pet Consort
This character has been captured and humiliatingly forced to be subjected to the twisted desires as part of someone's private harem.
Make [RooT.GetFirstName] your pet consort

If you want to enjoy [RooT.GetFirstName]'s company to entertain yourself in your free time, you could make [Root.GetHerHim] your consort. Remember that releasing [Root.GetHerHim] from your dungeon might allow him to flee.
That vile savage [From.GetFirstName] has forced me to become [From.GetHerHis] concubine!
[FromFrom.GetFirstName] has forced my [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] to become [FromFrom.GetHerHis] concubine!
[FromFrom.GetFirstName] has forced my [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] to become [FromFrom.GetHerHis] concubine!
[FromFrom.GetSheHeCap] will pay for this!
[FromFrom.GetSheHeCap] will pay for this!
Make Concubine
Take this character as your concubine.
Retire with Harem
Retire with your thralls for some sweet time.
Stop Debauchery
Leave the solace of your retirement and return to lead your people.
Wild Games
There's some crazy things happening in the harem of this ruler right now...

You've decided to take a break and retire with your beloved boytoys in your palace. With plenty of servants, food and drinks, it might be what it takes to find some relief from the pressures of command.
Let the fun start!
It was a good time, but you can't ignore your responsibilities forever. With a heavy heart, you finally called off your thralls and ordered the servants to clean up the mess.
Time to get back to rule!

All these days spent with servants coming at your every word and loving beautiful youngsters whispering sweet things into your ears have really made you understand what a wonderful and special person you are.
I'm so beautiful and smart!
A drink goes down and another barrel is empty. All this merriment and euphoria are just what you needed to relax.
Pour in some more mead!

Having not to worry about battle plans and plots and just try out the last exotic delicacies with your thralls is just what you needed. Eating enough to have your belly filling your lap is an acquired taste in itself.
Hmmmm...
You already knew what you were getting into with your vacation, but after some days of unrestrained passion you hardly understand how could you go on without any.
Call in that pretty servant over there!
It seems your celebration has had some collateral results. Your pregnancy is starting to show, with all its unpleasant effects, and you've been forced to call off the festivities.
That's so unfair...
Every day is just another pleasant day of doing nothing. You can hardly think about getting back to your duties anymore. After all, you have servants to deal with those.
Bring me... do... I don't even...
Spending such a great  time with other people doing all sorts of things is really helping to let you appreciate the joys of being with others.
We're all having lots of fun here!
Why worry about wars, plots and conquest when someone can find joy and love already?
I've already all that I need.

The last thrall forces another choke of meat down your throat and the cycle begins anew. With their help you've eaten more in these days than you have in your entire life. Yet, no matter how bloated and sweaty you've become, you just can't stop asking for more.
*omnomnomnomnom*

You don't know what you drank in the last weeks, but you can't really focus as you did any more, and pretty much anything will make you jump off your feet. But you can see so many things that weren't there before, you must take more of it.
What's THAT!?!
You almost drowned one of the new servants in wine today. Spending so much time only interacting with close and known faces might be making you a little too suspicious of others...
HE was the suspicious one!
Whether it be men or women, food or mead, you want it and aplenty, spending this time off let you understand there's nothing better than enjoying life as much as possible.
Nothing at all!
Being away from the problems of rulership for some time has really helped you placate your mind.
Thoughts are so soothing now...
You have so many attentions from thralls and servants, all of them listening to you, encouraging you, that you've started to feel a little better about yourself lately.
Maybe life isn't so bad...
You've spent some time away from your responsibilities as a ruler, but now maybe it's time to go back at it, isn't it? Having to lay motionless for entire days doesn't really help anybody...
It helps ME.
Quick, assemble my council!
You went on as long as you could, day after day, choking on foreign food and intoxicating elixirs, but your body cannot handle it any more.
Just get me to bed, please!
A second thrall comes over you, joining the first as he ravages your body.
More, please!
Having to wake with an hangover each morning, barely remembering what happened the previous day while being in no condition to live the next, has somehow lost its appeal to you.
There are other ways to get intoxicated after all...
Enough! Just get me some water and get out!

You glance nauseous at your bloated belly, trying to move on your side without throwing up. The servants wait around you with plates filled with more food, but right now it might as well be scorpions.
I'd rather do something else to waste time...
Enough prancing around, there's more important affairs to attend to!
Strange to believe it, but all these days doing nothing but feeding your libido seems to have finally satiated it. Right now the mere thought of calling one of your thralls would make you throw up.
Give it a few days, it'll come back...
Then this whole thing has outlived its usefulness.
Empty flattery after empty flattery, you're starting to hate all this frivolous attention to your body.
Less words, more fun.
Enough of this, you bore me.
Your thrall stands before you, at the mercy of your whims.
I've no longer need of this one. Release [From.GetHerHim].
Snip him, I've grown tired of his privates.
Kill [From.GetHerHim].
I've something... special... in mind for this one.
The scared thrall is dragged in your private dungeon to receive whatever special treatment you have in mind for [From.GetHerHim].
Keep still, I'm making some improvements on your face.
Something really special for this fine specimen...
Something really special for you, little one...
Hm, thinking again, you bore me. Get lost.
They always twitch, that can ruin a perfect work. But still, you're satisfied with your new piece. It's a new face altogether, something sublime.
Ever so close to perfection...

The stables under the moonlight are such a suggestive setup. Your favourite horse is already struggling in his place, smelling the new mate you've brought to him. What a mighty steed. Sometimes you almost feel like joining the fun you're submitting your thrall to.

The stables under the moonlight are such a suggestive setup. Your favourite Nauglir is already struggling in his place, smelling the new mate you've brought to him. What magnificent scales does it sport. Sometimes you almost feel like joining the fun you're submitting your thrall to.
Why not? Are you done yet?
Nah, he's having his fun already.
A few straps, needles and hooks, is all that a good artist really needs to have fun with, even if the subject of [Root.GetHerHis] affections is someone as base and meaningless as a thrall.
It's the gift of a true artist.

Draining blood, cutting flesh, there's all sorts of ways one can refine the body of even the most unworthy subject. You are really happy with the result of your work, the deadly look of the thrall really speaks to you.
Lean and refined.
The eyes of this one was what really caught your attention. They are so beautiful. Especially now that you had them added to your personal painter's last masterpiece.
They can still stare! It's beautiful.

It takes just little one spoonful of powder to create the most hilarious reactions in children. Look at how [FromFromFrom.GetSheHe] frets still. It almost makes one wonder what marvellous and terrible things the substance is allowing [FromFromFrom.GetHerHim] to see.
I'll join the kid.
Looking at [FromFromFrom.GetHerHim] is way better.

After some time, you've run out of things, yet you still think the kid could be made to eat something more. It's almost fascinating, really. And you work has made [FromFromFrom.GetHerHim] so plump and soft...
It looks almost... delicious...
Let's see if there's something more upstairs...
You really cannot understand when they cry. They become part of something beautiful, the sweetest of sensations binding two souls together. Certain to be one of their fondest memories in adulthood.
I still remember my first time...
The mind of a child is such a pure and delicate thing, to twist it is easy, but bending it to a point is the skill of a master.
Such as myself, of course.
What a thrilling and unique experience. Why do you even keep the most passionate of your lovers confined in the stables?
It's cruel.
You might have underestimated the ardour of your steed. In the frenzy of the passion he ended up hopelessly trampling your body.
Still... worth... it...
AI Dummy
AI Dummy
AI Dummy
Manage Concubine
Make of use of your toy however you see fit.
It would seem you are with child.
The brat better be worth all this nuisance...
Your wife finally saw it fit to tell you she's pregnant.
The brat better be mine.

You awoke with a sense of choking. You gasped, searching for air, but something large and wet is blocking your mouth. It takes some time to realize it is your very tongue, overgrown and blackened to unnatural proportions.
I can hide it, with magic!
There must be some way to mask this...
No point in hiding it.
There something itching on your head. When you move your hand up to scratch yourself, you realize two twisted horns are spurring from your forehead.
I can hide them, with magic!
There must be some way to mask this...
No point in hiding it.
It takes sometime to recognize the image you see in the reflection of your mirror. Some invisible hand has touched your features, blessing you with nobler traits.
Works for me.
It takes sometime to recognize the image you see in the reflection of your mirror. Some invisible hand has touched your features, cursing you with obscene traits.
Beauty is subjective.
There so much still to do, every new accomplishment in the heights of pleasure is overshadowed by a new greater compulsion. Will you ever be able to reach true perfection?
Of course I will!
With a clever use of your skills, you managed to hide your deformity, so as to pass like any normal person when in public.
There must be a permanent solution...
You hoped to hide your overgrown tongue, but no matter what, your courtiers soon caught on your act and rumours already started to spread.
Curses!
You hoped to hide your new horns, but no matter what, your courtiers soon caught on your act and rumours already started to spread.
Curses!
You've been exposed as a twisted servant of the Dark Powers.
Preposterous!
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has been exposed as a servant of the Dark Prince of Pleasure.
Time to come out and play.
How unexpected!
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has been exposed as a servant of the Dark Prince of Pleasure.
Time to come out and play.
How unexpected!
Twist
Try and make [RooT.GetFirstName] to understand what are the nice things in life.
You've decided to pick [From.GetFirstName] as the object of your attentions. What should you do with [From.GetHerHim]?
Toy with [From.GetHerHis] mind.
Titillate [From.GetHerHis] perception.
Tease [From.GetHerHis] cravings.
Inflame [From.GetHerHis] lust.
I changed my mind, [From.GetSheHe] bores me.
A little nudge here and there and [From.GetFirstName] has already started craving to better [From.GetHerHim]self, the first true step in the search for perfection.
But [From.GetSheHe] still needs more time.
I'll approach [From.GetHerHim].
Despite your efforts, [From.GetFirstName] still remains set in a complacent and sappy mindset, content with [From.GetHerHim]self.
Perhaps [From.GetSheHe] still needs more time.
I'll approach [From.GetHerHim] anyway.

You're attending at a feast in a foreign court when a masked figure comes close and starts talking to you. You spend hours discussing on the matters of beauty and pleasure and you start wondering if the man is trying to persuade you to join some cult.
This looks really interesting!
Thanks, but no thanks.

You approached [From.GetFirstName] during a public event and talked with [From.GetHerHim] for some time, until you finally convinced [From.GetHerHim] of the error of [From.GetHerHis] ways. Your new pet is eager to know and experience more.
Perfect.

You approached [From.GetFirstName] during a public event and talked with [From.GetHerHim] for some time, but in the end, there was no way of convincing [From.GetHerHim] of loosening up, even just a little, to understand the error of [From.GetHerHis] ways.
This is a lost cause.

A missing guard here, a misguided message there, it's hilarious how little things can twist someone's mind. [From.GetFirstName] has been on the edge for days, fearing for non-existent plots against [From.GetHerHim].
Give it more time...
I'll approach [From.GetHerHim].
Despite your efforts, [From.GetFirstName] still remains set in a complacent and trusting mindset, content with [From.GetHerHim]self.
Perhaps [From.GetSheHe] still needs more time.
I'll approach [From.GetHerHim] anyway.
Some well-placed rumours are all that takes to inflate someone's opinion. [From.GetFirstName] is filled with pride and would do anything to satiate [From.GetHerHis] thirst for flattery right now.
Perhaps [From.GetSheHe] still needs more time.
I'll approach [From.GetHerHim] now.
You tried to make [From.GetFirstName] respect [From.GetHerHim]self more, but the humility and self-loathing seem to be strong in this one.
Perhaps [From.GetSheHe] still needs more time.
I'll approach [From.GetHerHim] anyway.

Some nosy servants and anonymous gifts allowed [From.GetFirstName] to try some of the more exotic and pleasurable things in life, now that [From.GetSheHe] has gained an interest, nothing seems to satiate it.
Perhaps [From.GetSheHe] still needs more time.
I'll approach [From.GetHerHim] now.
Despite your efforts, [From.GetFirstName] remains a bland and frugal person, boring in [From.GetHerHis] interests as much as in [From.GetHerHis] character.
Perhaps [From.GetSheHe] still needs more time.
I'll approach [From.GetHerHim] anyway.

Making sure the right servants slipped the right beverage in the right chalice is an art in itself. Now [From.GetFirstName] has already started to develop a more interesting and colourful personality.
Perhaps [From.GetSheHe] still needs more time.
I'll approach [From.GetHerHim] now.

Boytoys and wenches aren't hard to find and they can make the most believable actors when paid enough. It is delightful to think how one can be able to create love with precision and intent. For as long as [From.GetFirstName] believe them, isn't it true love?
Perhaps [From.GetSheHe] still needs more time.
I'll approach [From.GetHerHim] now.

Using minor instruments to exact your art is demeaning and obviously can lead to gross mistakes. The help you hired to drag [From.GetFirstName] out of [From.GetHerHis] bland and uninteresting shyness has likely had the entire opposite effect.
Perhaps [From.GetSheHe] still needs more time.
I'll approach [From.GetHerHim] anyway.
Become Celibate
You've faced a particularly troublesome pregnancy. The next could be lethal. Maybe it would be best to abstain, rather than risk?

Gaen Vale, the most sacred place for the Asur, the core of Ulthuan and the centre of the Vortex which keeps the Chaos from pouring in and unravel the World is under attack. Would you stand with the Everqueen and defend the very heart of your homeland?
Sail, to war!
May the Gods protect them.

§Y$CLAIMANT$§! can declare war to retake Ulthuan, the ancestral homeland of all Elves. You will prepare a large invasion for two years, during which troops and commanders will be gathered from all corners of your provinces. If you fail to wage war within these two years, you'll be shamed.
Reconquest of [Title.GetBaseName]
Reconquest of $OTHER_TITLE$
Prepare Reconquest

Ulthuan is your ancestral birthright. The time has now come to return and reclaim it from those who once drove your people out. Once you've made up your mind, you'll organize a great invasion in the next two years, during which you'll be able to wage war against Ulthuan at any time.

News have reached you [From.GetTitledFirstName] has started preparing a great invasion to reclaim Ulthuan. The wretched armies of corrupt Druchii raiders and witches gather already under [From.GetHerHis] banner.

News have reached you [From.GetTitledFirstName] has started preparing a great invasion to reclaim Ulthuan. The wretched armies of feeble Asur warriors and mages gather already under [From.GetHerHis] banner.
We must prepare.
We must prepare.

You've stalled for too long. Slowly, the forces you've gathered for your great invasion have lost their interest and fallen into petty squabbles for power, leaving you with no united force to wrestle Ulthuan from the wretched Asur.

You've stalled for too long. Slowly, the forces you've gathered for your great campaign of reconquest have lost their interest, thorn by debates regarding the validity of attacking now and leaving you with no united force to wrestle Ulthuan from the wretched Druchii.
Incompetent fools!
It'll be for another time...
A great host of raiders has gathered under your banner, they wait anxiously to set sail for Ulthuan.
A great host of warriors has gathered under your banner,they wait anxiously to set sail for Ulthuan.
Good.
A famous raider has come to your court, offering his allegiance and willingness to help you reclaim Ulthuan for a small share of the spoils.
A famous commander has come to your court, offering his allegiance and willingness to help you reclaim Ulthuan and deliver it from its corruption.
Good.
A small host of raiders has gathered under your banner, they wait anxiously to set sail for Ulthuan.
A small host of warriors has gathered under your banner, they wait anxiously to set sail for Ulthuan.
Good.
§Y$CLAIMANT$§! can declare war to subjugate any Druchii ruler who opposes us.
Druchii Subjugation of [Title.GetBaseName]
$ORDER$$SECOND_ADJ$ Druchii Subjugation of $OTHER_TITLE$
Feed to nauglir
Feed this prisoner to your favourite cold one.
Feed to Dragon
Feed this prisoner to your dragon.
Feed to Griffon
Feed this prisoner to your griffon.
Your prisoner is thrown in the public pit and the cold one is released soon after. The creature growls and hisses at the victim for a while and then leaps forward, ripping them apart.
Who's hungry?
Your jailer has decided to punish you by tossing you in their pit and have a cold one devour you.
Aaah!!
Your prisoner is tied in the middle of the square, for all to see. At your call, the dragon comes down from above, burning them to a crisp and feasting on the remains.
Who's hungry?
Your jailer has decided to punish you by tossing you in their pit and have their dragon devour you.
Aaah!!

Your prisoner is tied in the middle of the square, for all to see. At your call, the griffon comes down from above, wrapping his claws around the body of the victim and starting to peel off skin with his beak, feasting while the prisoner is still alive and screaming.
Who's hungry?
Your jailer has decided to punish you by tossing you in their pit and have their Griffon devour you.

And so it has come to pass that not a man but a woman trained in the arcane arts defeated the Witch King. For centuries Malekith forbade men from practising magic under his lands, needlessly fearing for a prophecy which is clear now he so greatly misunderstood. This is a great day for the Asur, as their greatest enemy has been defeated and the remaining Druchii will soon fight amongst themselves for his legacy.

And so it has come to pass that a mage defeated the Witch King, just as Caledor prophesied. For centuries Malekith forbade men from practising magic under his lands, but in the end there was nothing he could do to avoid his destiny. This is a great day for the Asur, as their greatest enemy has been defeated and the remaining Druchii will soon fight amongst themselves for his legacy.

And so it has come to pass that a commoner defeated the Witch King. For centuries Malekith forbade men from practising magic under his lands, fearing the a mage would have been born and trained in the arcane art, become more powerful than him and destroy him, like Caledor prophesied. Yet, in the end, it was through mundane means that the Witch King of Naggaroth found his end. This is a great day for the Asur, as their greatest enemy has been defeated and the remaining Druchii will soon fight amongst themselves for his legacy.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has grown weary of the squabbling of [From.GetHerHis] subjects. As days go by, you've felt drawn closer to the heart of Athel Loren, the Oak of the Ages. You've finally embraced the call of the Gods and, as you enter the the ancient tree, you feel the benevolence and wisdom of Isha filling your very being. What happens later is indescribable, but when you've come out you've become more than a mere elf.

Winter is coming closer and once again you feel the call of the Oak of Ages, to burn, die and be reborn from  the heart of Athel Loren in spring.
The summer is coming to an end and you feel more and more tired everyday. The call of Athel Loren compels you to yield to your torpor and sleep until the next spring.
So be it.
So be it.
So be it.
With the spring giving new life and colour to the woods, you emerge once more from your sleep, reinvigorated by the power of Athel Loren, once more ready to defend it.

Something is wrong. You've awakened with a strange thirst for blood this year. The minds of all the Great Hunters are shrieking inside your mind, demanding for you to protect the sacred glades and slaughter all those who are planning to do harm upon them.
Blow the horns! It is time we hunt!
This year Kurnous has come back to life maddened with lust for blood. Already his call resonates over the glades, calling all the creatures of the forest to hunt, driving spirits and beasts insane.
Blreaaarh!!!
The horns pierce my ears!
What's all this ruckus about?
The Weave is out of balance. Day after day you hear whispers and shrieks beneath your bark, it becomes harder to focus, to keep calm.
Blreaaarh!!!

Athel Loren is not kind on those who fail to respect and preserve its boundaries. The branches and leaves twist and reach out by their own will and by the blink of an eye, part of your hold has disappeared.

All in Athel Loren is about balance, summer and winter, death and rebirth, light and darkness. The endless cycles of the great seasons determine the existence of all beings. The Asrai understand the delicate nature of the Weave and do not shun from embracing all of its forms.

The more time passes, the more it appears clear your student has decided to shun darkness and embrace the path of the Lightweaver, to heal the sickness and corruption that may tarnish the forest and preserve its pureness.

Spellsingers are the powerful magic-users of the Asrai. They tap into the Weave of Athel Loren and through this bond they can reshape the forest around them. After your long studies, you've been acknowledged as a learned mage of the Asrai people.
