Your [GetFromRelation] is spending a lot of time teaching you how a necromancer should be cautious. One should never be taken by surprise by how easily a spirit could break its chains or an horde lose its purpose.
I'll try and be careful.
Your [GetFromRelation] is spending a lot of time teaching you how a necromancer should be bold and daring. You must harden yourself to the horrors you'll witness and never hesitate in your choices.
I will.

Your [GetFromRelation] is spending a lot of time teaching you how a necromancer should always remain calm and maintain absolute discipline at all times, for it is a vital component for casting even the simplest spell.
Of course.
You've succeeded, you can feel the dark power flowing through your veins, compelling the dead to listen to your commands. You are a necromancer.
Despite your best efforts, it seems necromancy is not the right thing for you. Your many years of study qualified you only for graverobbing.
Excellent.
Damnations.
Your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] has exceeded your expectations. Under [From.GetHerHis] will, the dead walk again. Your work is done.
Good.
It would seem your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] has taken a dark path and mastered the art of necromancy.
I see...
[From.GetFirstName] revealed [From.GetHerHim]self to be a failure. Despite your efforts, [From.GetSheHe] doesn't seem capable of mastering the dark arts.
What a waste.
It would seem your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName]'s attempts at mastering the art of Necromancy ended in failure.
I see...
As the blood of the sacrifice runs across the altar, you feel the Wind of Death blow stronger. Another step closer to your ritual.
Yes. We need more.

You are ready to perform your necromantic ritual. The greater the power you will commit, the greater the horde which will be raised from the grave to obey your commands. At least, until they fall apart once more.
All shall fall and serve me in death!
A great host to bring fear to my enemies.
A large horde to serve my every need.
A small horde, nothing excessive.
Only a few servants for my personal needs.
Once the spell has been completed, a few hundred skeletons and zombies gather before you, ready to obey your every order.
Good.
The remaining corpses in your small horde fall back into the ground, devoid of life once more.
Once the spell has been completed, a few hundred skeletons and zombies gather before you, ready to obey your every order. Looking at them, they seem to be a little more numerous than you expected.
All the better.
The remaining undead in your small horde fall back into the ground, devoid of life once more.
Once the spell has been completed, thousands of skeletons and other undead gather before you, ready to obey your every order.
Good.
Your small horde finally falls apart, once more lacking any semblance of life.

Once the spell has been completed, a few thousand skeletons and other undead gather before you, ready to obey your every order. Looking at them, they seem to be a little more numerous than you expected.
All the better.
Your small horde finally falls apart, devoid once more of any semblance of life.
A great collection of undead of every kind assembles before you, answering your call. The ritual has bore a wonderful harvest.
Good.
Your horde of undead finally falls apart, devoid once more of any energy.
A great collection of undead of every kind assembles before you, answering your call. The ritual has bore a great harvest. They seem more numerous than you expected, too.
All the better.
Your horde of undead finally falls apart, devoid once more of any semblance of life.
Once your ritual ends all of the land before you has withered and a great host of undead has risen, filling the fields, ready to do your bidding.
Good.
Your great horde of undead finally falls apart, devoid once more of any semblance of life.

Once your ritual ends all of the land before you has withered and a great host of undead has risen, filling the fields, ready to do your bidding. They are so many, you can barely see the ground on which they walk.
All the better.
Your great horde of undead finally falls apart, devoid once more of any semblance of life.
Only the Great Necromancer himself could have outdone such a feat: you've sucked all life from this land and through your great ritual an endless horde of corpses has arisen to follow your whims.
To war, my minions!
The strain is too much and your titanic horde finally falls apart, returning to the dirt once more.
Only the Great Necromancer himself could have outdone such a feat: you've sucked all life from this land and through your great ritual an endless horde of corpses has arisen to follow your whims.
To war, my minions!
The strain is too much and your titanic horde finally falls apart, returning to the dirt once more.

You've studied [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledName]'s routine for some time and believe you could hire an agent to slip through to [Root.PlotTarget.GetHerHis] resting place and steal the ring at the right moment...
My co-conspirators will provide...
I'll take proper precautions...
We need an experienced burglar for this.
Too risky - I will bide my time.
This might be the right time. A good thief could sneak and steal the ring.
Ask the Plot head for funds
I'll take the proper precautions...
We need an experienced burglar for this.
Too risky - I will bide my time.
My co-conspirator, [From.GetTitledName], is asking for funds to hire a thief in order to steal [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledName]'s ring while [Root.PlotTarget.GetHerHim] is resting...
Very well - too bad I will not see it!
Even [Root.PlotTarget.GetHerHis] death is not worth it.
[From.GetTitledName] has sent me the necessary funds to steal [From.PlotTarget.GetTitledName]'s ring...
[From.GetTitledName] has refused to fund the master thief needed to steal [From.PlotTarget.GetTitledName]'s ring.
I will pay for it myself!
Forget it.
There are no dreams accompanying your rest during daylight, only the stillness of full death, the one true time when you look no different from a corpse.
And yet.. I feel someone's touch...

There are no dreams accompanying your rest during daylight, only the stillness of full death, but you can still feel the thief's touch on your hand. The vile man has fled the room once you finally awake, but you've smelled his scent before...
A million deaths for [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]!
There are no dreams accompanying your rest during daylight, only the stillness of full death, you can only feel the touch of the thief once he's long gone, along with your ring.
My ring! My ring!!!

There are no dreams accompanying your rest during daylight, only the stillness of full death, but you can still feel the thief's touch on your hand. With a sudden gesture your claws snap at his neck, raising the pathetic mortal from the ground and holding him still until he whispers terrified the name of his employer.
[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]? So be it.

There are no dreams accompanying your rest during daylight, only the stillness of full death, but you can still feel the thief's touch on your hand. With a sudden gesture your claws snap at his neck, but the wretched mortal is fast enough to flee, albeit empty-handed.
Who could have sent him?
My co-conspirator, [From.GetTitledName], has let me know that [From.GetSheHe] has finally found a man skilled and brave enough to try and steal [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledName]'s ring for you.
He better not screw this up.
[From.GetTitledName] approves of your idea to hire an agent to steal [From.PlotTarget.GetTitledName]'s ring.
Make the preparations.

[From.GetTitledName] has let me know that the plot to steal [From.PlotTarget.GetTitledName]'s ring is proceeding well. The thief will act on [From.PlotTarget.GetHerHim] while [From.PlotTarget.GetSheHe] rests within one month.
Good.
Success! [From.GetTitledName]'s ring is in your hands. Unfortunately, your complicity was discovered.
Good. But... bad.
Success! That thief was really as skilled as he boasted. [From.GetTitledName] has lost [From.GetHerHis] ring and knows nothing of your involvement.
And now...
Failure! [From.GetTitledName] captured the thief and squeezed your name out of him.
This is bad...
Failure! [From.GetTitledName] woke before the thief could steal the ring, but my complicity has not been revealed.
We will just have to try again.
Tell [This.GetTitledName] of the idea to steal [This.PlotTarget.GetTitledName]'s ring
Ask [This.GetTitledName] for funds to steal [This.PlotTarget.GetTitledName]'s ring
[This.GetTitledName] receives the funds
Inform [This.GetTitledName] that I will not pay
Steal [This.GetTitledName]'s ring during [This.GetHerHis] rest next month
Approve the plan

The dreaded ring of [From.GetFirstName] now lies within your hands. Through this wicked artifact [From.GetTitledFirstName] has been able to return from death time and again. Legend has it any vampire could master such a power by wearing this trinket.
And it is MINE now.
I will make sure nobody will ever see this thing again.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has wrested control over the powerful Carstein Ring and now rules over [From.GetHerHis] undead hordes backed by its promise of immortality.
I see...
It has been days now, but still no trace of the thief. The wretched scum must have fled who knows where with your ring!
A thousand curses!
Terror from Darkness
Vampires have been known to use their innate necromantic powers to piece together monstrous creatures that would fly them into the night and upon their prey.
I've better things to spend time on.
After months of hard work, the monster is finally ready. The shrieking abomination craves for the blood of your enemies and is ready to fly you wherever you wish.
Good.
With the Witch King gone, none of the Druchi despots seem to recognize you or anybody else as their new ruler. The mighty realm built around the immortal descendant of Aenarion has died with him.
Curses.

With the Witch King gone, none of the Druchi despots seems to recognizing you or anybody else as their new ruler. It took centuries for Malekith to consolidate his rule by pitting the other Dark Elves one against the other. The natural consequences of his decisions are now falling upon you.
Curses.
Ulthuan has closed its borders. You can no longer enjoy its protection. On the other hand you are no longer obliged to pay tribute towards it.
Grim times indeed...
No cell will hold you as long as the great forces of Athel Loren are with you.
The spirits freed me.
Trying to hold the Avatar of Isha herself while inside Athel Loren was folly: the goddess has freed herself with the help of a legion of angered forest spirits.
Trying to hold the Avatar of Kurnous himself while inside Athel Loren was folly: the god has broken out of your boundaries with a horde of angry spirits.
Athel Loren is deeply connected with the forest spirits. The one you tried to hold slipped away, welcomed by the very ground of its homeland.
Damnations.
After much deliberation, the Council-Knights have decided who will take the mantle of Grand Master of the Templars of Sigmar.
Finally.
As you're no longer capable of giving orders nor exact any of your duties, the other Masters have decided to relieve you of your position from within the Council.
Hnnnghllh...
It was but a formality to convince the other Council-Knights of [From.GetFirstName]'s discharge. A new, better Templar will take [From.GetHerHis] place now.
Good.

[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] has accused you of bad conduct, reuniting the other Master Templars of the Council and claiming you are no longer fit to hold your current position within the holy congregation.
Absurd!

[FromFromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] has accused [From.GetTitledFirstName] of bad conduct, reuniting the other Master Templars of the Council and claiming [From.GetHerHim] to be unfit for duty. What is your opinion on the matter?
The accuse has merits.
The accuse is baseless.

The Council has spoken: [From.GetTitledFirstName] has stained [From.GetHerHis] office with clumsiness and unholy conduct and must therefore be removed immediately, lest [From.GetSheHe] lead further corruption inside the Order.
The Council has spoken: [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s accuses are unfounded and every charge against [From.GetHerHim] should be lifted.
Burn [From.GetHerHim]!
Exile it is.
The accuser was obviously misled.
The Council-Knights were on the side of the accuser. The Order has sentenced you to death by the stake for your unholy conduct, to cleanse the Temple from your stain.
Arrrgh!
The Council-Knights were on the side of the accuser. The Order has sentenced you to exile for your unholy conduct, you are to abandon your possessions and leave at once, never to return.
You are mistaken!
Your work has been accomplished. The Council-Knights have recognized the righteousness of your charges and burned the vile apostate to cleanse the holy walls of the Order.
Praised be Sigmar.
Your work has been accomplished. The Council-Knights have recognized the righteousness of your charges and exiled the vile apostate forever from the Order.
Yet the blasphemer still breathes...
The Order does not make mistakes, clearly your accuser was the one being misled, for the Council-Knights have agreed upon your innocence of all charges.
I never doubted the Order to see the Truth.
Some foul power must be aiding the blasphemer, for the Council-Knights could not see the unholiness beneath them and decided to drop your charges.
There are no innocents!

You feel that with the impending doom of Chaos looming over all, your life cannot have a meaning, if not pledged on the defense of the world against this deadly threat. You've decided to enter the Holy Order of the Templars of Sigmar and fight the wicked.
I'll ask my liege at once.
Well, thinking back at it...

Your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] has decided to leave and join the Witch Hunters, to fight corruption everywhere, pledging [From.GetHerHis] life to cleanse the enemies of humanity from the world.
Go in the light of Sigmar, [GetFromRelation].
Nonsense, I have plans for you here.
Your [GetFromRelation] understood your request and decided to grant your wish.
Your [GetFromRelation] did not seem to understand nor share your concerns and denied you to leave.
But I could make a difference!

Esteemed [Root.GetTitledName],

I write you in dire need of help. My realm is incurring in several expenses which go beyond the capacities of my treasury. I humbly ask your Order for support in these dark time, promising I'll soon be able to repay in full the sum requested.

Humbly,
[FromFrom.GetTitledName]
Request granted.
The Order has no money to spare right now.

Most virtuous [Root.GetTitledFirstName], of course we, the Holy Order of the Templars of Sigmar, can lend you 500 gold. All that we ask in return is your future assistance in certain matters as they might arise. Sigmar protects,\n\nGrand Master [From.GetFirstName]

Most virtuous [Root.GetTitledFirstName], sadly, I must decline your request of 500 gold. The Holy Order of the Templars of Sigmar is tangled in a never-ending battle agaisnt Chaos and such a war requires our every resource. Sigmar protects,\n\nGrand Master [From.GetFirstName]
Curses.

Esteemed [Root.GetTitledName],

I, humble servant of Sigmar, send you this small sum to aid you in your battle against corruption and to show my unrelenting support for the good and virtuous Templars of the Order.

Humbly,
[FromFrom.GetTitledName]
Most virtuous [Root.GetTitledFirstName], the Order gladly accepts your humble donation and takes note of your outstanding action for future reference,\n\nGrand Master [From.GetFirstName]

Accursed [Root.GetTitledName],

Your attempts at obstructing our holy charge do nothing but confirm your wickedness. Be assured the Order shall not rest until your heresy has been exposed and the corruption in your realm wiped out through our Lord's blessed flames.

By the glory of Sigmar,
[FromFrom.GetTitledName]
That went well...

Esteemed [Root.GetTitledName],

Despite your virtuous charge, I've found your Order's envoys to be nothing but agitators and murderers. Although this might be through none of your or your noble peers's fault, I see it no longer in my interest to allow the agents of the Order to roam within my realm.

Humbly,
[FromFrom.GetTitledName]
The slyness betrays [FromFrom.GetHerHis] heresy.

Esteemed [Root.GetTitledName],

I see now the error of our ways and desire to immediately make ammends for our past mistakes by opening once more my realm's gates to the Holy Order's agents, so that you may continue your righteous charge here.

Humbly,
[FromFrom.GetTitledName]

Most virtuous [Root.GetTitledFirstName], the Order is relieved of your wise decision. We shall soon send new agents in your court to root out whatever vile heresy has sprung in your realm during our absence and properly eradicate it,\n\nGrand Master [From.GetFirstName]
Good.

Esteemed [Root.GetTitledName],

Our agents have found interest and promise in  your [GetFromFromRelation]'s [FromFrom.GetFirstName] and, due to your existing dept towards the Order, we ask, in exchange for an extension to your charge, to receive [FromFrom.GetHerHim], to be trained as a Templar of the Order.

Sigmar's grace,
[From.GetTitledName]

Esteemed [Root.GetTitledName],

As you've yet to repay the Order for our generous loan to your treasury, we ask, in an exchange for an extension to your charge, to allow us to build a fortress in a province of our choosing within your borders.

Sigmar's grace,
[From.GetTitledName]
As agreed upon, a fortress has been built in [Root.GetName] to be garrisoned by the holy warriors of the Templar Order.

Esteemed [Root.GetTitledName],

We've found a good area within your borders to build a fortress of the Order, from which to extend our protection against heresy and corruption. The Order humbly ask to receive permission to build such a fortress in your realm.

Sigmar's grace,
[From.GetTitledName]
As agreed upon, a fortress has been built in [Root.GetName] to be garrisoned by the holy warriors of the Templar Order.
I require your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] for the Order.
Granted.
I'll pay my debt instead.
Denied.

Esteemed [Root.GetTitledName],

I am glad to allow [FromFrom.GetFirstName] to join the Holy Order of the Templars. May [FromFrom.GetSheHe] aid you well in your sacred quest against heresy and corruption.

Humbly,
[From.GetTitledName]
Good.

Esteemed [Root.GetTitledName],

While I have no desire to go against the wishes of the Order, I understand this request comes from my upstanding debt towards your treasury, which I am now ready to pay in exchange for the future of [FromFrom.GetFirstName].

Humbly,
[From.GetTitledName]
Acceptable...

Esteemed [Root.GetTitledName],

While I have no desire to go against the wishes of the Order, I must deny this request, for [FromFrom.GetFirstName] is very dear to me and I would not want to be departed from [FromFrom.GetHerHim] at this time.

Humbly,
[From.GetTitledName]
Why? What depraved deed are they concocting?
I require land in [From.GetName] to build a fortress for the Order.
Very well.
I'll pay my debt instead.
Denied.

Esteemed [Root.GetTitledName],

I am glad to allow your Order to build an outpost within my borders. I am certain everyone will feel safer knowing that the Templars are protecting us.

Humbly,
[From.GetTitledName]
Good.

Esteemed [Root.GetTitledName],

While I have no desire to go against the wishes of the Order, I understand this request comes from my upstanding debt towards your treasury, which I am now ready to pay in exchange for the land in [FromFrom.GetName].

Humbly,
[From.GetTitledName]
Acceptable...

Esteemed [Root.GetTitledName],

While I have no desire to go against the wishes of the Order, I must deny this request, for [FromFrom.GetName] is a precious part of my demesne and I'd not like to be departed from it.

Humbly,
[From.GetTitledName]
Why? What depraved acts are being performed there?

[Root.GetTitledName],

The Order of the Templars of Sigmar will not let you stand alone against the growing darkness. Hold steady, for we will come and bear the full might of our Lord upon your enemies.

By Sigmar's grace,
[From.GetTitledName]
Good.

[Root.GetTitledName],

The Order of the Templars of Sigmar is sympathetic to your just cause, but cannot spare men at the time being to aid you in your war.

Sigmar protects,
[From.GetTitledName]
Curses.

Esteemed [Root.GetTitledName],

I beseech the Holy Order for assistance against most foul enemies I am assaulted from. This unholy creatures could certainly be no match for the Templars of Sigmar.

Humbly,
[From.GetTitledName]
We shall join you at once!
Not this time, sadly.

Esteemed [Root.GetTitledName],

The Holy Order of the Templars of Sigmar requires your compliance for an investigation within your borders. We are certain of the collaboration of any Sigmar-fearing good ruler.

Humbly,
[From.GetTitledName]
Request granted.
I'd rather pay our standing debt.
Request denied.

Esteemed [Root.GetTitledName],

I am glad to allow your agents to scour my lands. I am certain everyone will feel safer knowing that the Templars are protecting us.

Humbly,
[From.GetTitledName]
Good.

Esteemed [Root.GetTitledName],

While I have no desire to go against the wishes of the Order, I understand this request comes from my upstanding debt towards your treasury, which I am now ready to pay in exchange for your discretion.

Humbly,
[From.GetTitledName]
Acceptable...

Esteemed [Root.GetTitledName],

While I have no desire to go against the wishes of the Order, I must deny this request. I assure you there is nothing wrong in my lands and your presence might do nothing but stir the peasants.

Humbly,
[From.GetTitledName]
Why? What depraved acts are being performed there?

Blessed brother [Root.GetFirstName],

The Order commands you to go on a mission to root out Chaos and depravity wherever you'll find them.

Sigmar be with you,
[From.GetTitledName]
So it shall be!
After relentless days of work, the Witch Hunter sent by the Order has cleansed the province of [Root.GetName] of any wicked influence.
I see...

Blessed [Root.GetTitledFirstName],

By the grace of Sigmar, I have scoured these lands and brought swift justice upon any form of corruption and depravity I've there found. Do you wish me to proceed with my investigation at the court of the local lord or to return to the Temple?

Sigmar protects,
[From.GetTitledName]
Go and burn any wicked soul you find.
Go and capture any wicked soul you find.
Your work is done, return to us.
Your suspicions might have been all too correct. Word is sent your agent [From.GetFirstName] has tragically and mysteriously disappeared in the province [From.GetSheHe] was sent to investigate upon.
Something lurks there...

Blessed [Root.GetTitledFirstName],

Sigmar be with you. I have completed my task, hunted down and publically executed all those who scourged these lands with sin, Grand Master. May the glorious light of Sigmar shine upon these lands once more.

Sigmar protects,
[From.GetTitledName]
Good. Return to us now.

Blessed [Root.GetTitledFirstName],

Sigmar be with you. I have completed my task, hunted down and sent back to the Temple all those who were suspicious enough to be hiding corruption within them, Grand Master. May you judge them and bring an end to their vile ways.

Sigmar protects,
[From.GetTitledName]
Good. Return to us now.

You thought you could live with it, but never growing old, never being an adult has turned your unlife into a curse. Are you even meant to think these things? You are still a child, after all. You will always be a child.
I want new toys!
Nothing, nothing excites you any longer. Your vampiric senses allow you to perceive any smell, any touch to its fullest, but you've satiated yourself with all the world had to offer to you.
No! There must be something more!
All the people you care about grow old and die, the world has changed into a foreign and distasteful place, yet you're still the same, a relic of a past long gone, without any real purpose left.
Why do anything at all?

It's a warm day and, even in your palace, you feel uncomfortable. You long for the cold embrace of your dear mother. Once you approach her to ask for some hours of cuddling, you also realize you feel somewhat hungry and your eyes fall eerily on her breasts.

It's a warm day and, even in your palace, you feel uncomfortable. You long for the cold embrace of your dear mother. That is, if you add a proper one. Just like you, she's never grown old, to the point you have started doubting if she's your mother at all.
Hug me, mommy!

Your spawn, trapped in a childish body and devolved into a childish mind has come to you today, asking for some affection. As [From.GetSheHe] throws [From.GetHerHim]self on you, [From.GetHerHis] fangs already try and find a way towards your chest.
Today your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] has come crying to you, saying you're not [From.GetHerHis] real mother, but rather a deceitful girl.
Oh, alright then... But just this once!
Get away from me!
No, you're the only child!

Your mother spends almost the whole day rocking you on her lap, allowing you to suckle milk and blood from her breast until satiated. When you finally fall asleep, she carries you back to your coffin.

Your mother spends almost the whole day rocking you on her lap, allowing you to suckle milk and blood from her breast until satiated. When you finally fall asleep, she carries you back to your coffin.
And now you'll be my mum forever!
We should do this more often, mum!
Your mother refused your request, scolding you with some nonsense about being too old for what you asked for.
But mum!..

You grab your child's hair, mocking [From.GetHerHim] for crying and starting to gleefully let [From.GetHerHim] chase you. You turn into fog, call for wolves to catch each other's scent, have undead fight for your wounded honor and finally and happily fall asleep together as the dawn approaches.
Best time ever!

It was already hard being with an eternal child, but recently your love has started to act more and more like one. You do not know how should you feel about your partner or how should you be together from further on.

It was already hard being with an eternal child, but recently your love has started to act more and more like one. It was a fun quirk at the beginning, like a proper aristocrat develops in its long life, but now it grow into an embarassement of sorts. You do not know how should you feel about your partner or how should you be together from further on.
I can't love a child.
This was never about love anyway.
Actually, this is kind of intriguing...

Your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] has been acting strangely lately, avoiding you all the time. When pressured, [From.GetFirstName] admitted that [From.GetSheHe] cannot love a child like you appear to be.

Your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] has been acting strangely lately, avoiding you all the time. When pressured, [From.GetFirstName] admitted that your child-like behaviour embarrasses [From.GetHerHim] and doesn't want to have anything to do with you.
Fine! I don't want your cooties anyway.

Your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] has been acting strangely lately, avoiding you all the time. Not that you really care about a grown-up like [From.GetHerHim], but it is annoying to not having [From.GetHerHim] around when you need [From.GetHerHim].
I'm hungry! Fetch me someone to drink!

You felt a little weird when your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] shared bed with you today after so long. You weren't sure about it, but some of the funny things [From.GetSheHe] did with you were quite pleasing.
Do we do it again tomorrow?
The more you try new things to stimulate your senses, the more you grow accustomed to excesses and depravities. You have grown to have quite the reputation amongst your fellow aristocrats.
Who cares? I want more! I can barely feel anything!
Your skin feels cold and stale, your mind is feverish for the need of new sensations. What can you do to appease your desire?
Cut the flesh, bring the pain!
Feeding on life, what else could be more exilerating?
I need someone to sate this desire.
Anything! Just... just anything!
What does it matter how deep you cut with your nails and fangs? You can already see your wounds healing.
It's useless!
You feed and feed upon a dozen or so different victims, some provided by the servants, some willingly submitting to your grasp. But even after you're wallowed in their blood, you feel nothing.
More!

Blood is not enough to placate your desire, so you start taking pieces of meat from your victims as well, gorging on the flesh of the living against all your instincts. The repulsion you feel is dim, but at least it is something.
More!

There's always some young thrall around, too young to have dignity, too eager to rise to care about shame, but ravaging their body gives you no pleasure. There is no itch, not the way the mortals feel, not way some of the other aristocrats claim to feel.
Why can't I feel it!?!
You needed something different from another cold body to rub over yours, but the warmth of the servant you pinned on your bed does not make you feel any passion, just a mild annoying thirst.
Always thirst, I hate it! Can't I feel ANYTHING ELSE!?!

A mortal is just some cattle, a vampire another cold body without any passion in it. You thought a ghoul would be the middle ground where you could find a little excitement, but the pitiful creature is nothing but cattle with a worse stench.
Grrrmmnhh...

Nobody understand what you need to feel anything, nobody knows how empty you are. You thought commanding an undead would give you something new and something that could push exactly as far as you ordered. But the shambling rotting body has no fire within it, all the actions you order it to take resonate hollow within your mind.
Useless sack of bones!

You dance around the shadow, looking at the first burns, then daring your eyes up in the clean sky. The rush of fear and repulsion runs through your body, shrieking for you to hide inside, but you move another step forward, inebriated by that terror and the smell of your own flesh burning under the sunlight.
Ahhh...

The chains twist your limbs, while the hooks slowly tear out pieces of your flesh. Soon, the wounds will close and then the pain will go away, allowing that new sensation to come about, the weird feeling of having healed parts dislocated from their correct position.
Ahhh...

The twin-tailed comet, the hammer of Sigmar, looking at them feels you with fear and just for that you feel compelled to go against your instincts and place your hands on the holy symbols, reveling on the pain and revulsion summoned by Nagash's curse.
I can almost feel him chant the spell...

You take your arm out of the river, noting how the running water withered and corroded your perfect pale flesh. It is an intriguing sensation, one mortals could not describe. It is not like being burned, but it has a similar effect. As you watch your exposed bones, you immerse the arm once more.
Yes!
There is nothing and no-one for you to live for anymore. And yet, you remain in this eternal life, condemned to live until after the end of times.
Why can't I die?

There was a time when you were a greater person. When your servants knew how to properly respect their betters, when you could dream of conquests and exquisite endeavors. Yet it is all gone, your life now but a hollow memory of what it was.
The past... is all I have left...
You feel like the world holds no interest for you anymore. You have no longer place in it and thus, you slowly fall into hibernation.
I'll dream of what was...
You suddenly feel something, as if the unlife as unmoving corpse could be worst of what you left, however little it was.
It is time to wake! I am back.
No... no... I will sleep, for now...
The dreaded Red Duke has risen once again, to claim his rule over Aquitaine and all of Bretonnia.
Follow me to war, brothers!
I will bide my time...
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has gathered new fledglings to increase the size of [From.GetHerHis] host, bringing prestige to your name.
Good.

In your long quest for perfection you've defeated countless enemies and ravaged entire provinces. In this search, your men collected several trinkets. It is only right to send some of them to the Master of your Order.
They have no value to me anyway.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has quested long and hard, honing [From.GetHerHis] skills in [From.GetHerHis] search for perfection. Although of little value to your Order, [From.GetSheHe] has sent part of [From.GetHerHis] spoils of war as tribute in your honor.
Trinkets.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has tricked you: the fiend is nothing but a Prince of Darkness and has now taken [event_target:eloper.GetFirstName] away from you, turning it into an unliving abomination.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has tricked you, the vampire has seen something in [event_target:eloper.GetFirstName] and snatched [event_target:eloper.GetHerHim] away from you, turning it into [From.GetHerHis] fledgling.
[From.GetSheHe] could have asked...
How dare [From.GetSheHe]!
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has found some young talented mortal to join From.GetHerHis] ranks and turned the human into another member of the Order.
It better be very talented.

The Blood Dragons have deployed their mindless and relentless servants to permanently occupy the province of [Root.GetName], if the county is not freed soon, a new enemy fortress shall rise within your very borders.
They must be stopped!
The Blood Dragons in [Root.GetName], have completed their work: a dreaded fortress stands within your lands, housing new undead forces.
Damnations!
Flights of Devils

A Knight as powerful as you are deserves a mighty steed to go with [Root.GetHerHim]. You may embark in a short quest to find your very own Nightmare to ride, although it might keep you away for a while.
There it is, a dark and twisted form, gallopping through the somber clouds of a stormy night, your new steed. It is finally time to go back home.
The Blood Quest
It is decided. You send word through your hold so that all those armed with bravery, skill and craving for perfection be called to ride at your side in this great quest.
We march at sunset!

[Root.GetTitledFirstName],

I call you, who claim to have valor and skill, to join me in a daring quest ashore. We shall fight and kill, laying waste upon unworthy weaklings, reveling in the thrill of the hunt and the challenge of good game.

Will you be with us?
[From.GetTitledName]
I'll ready my steed!
I'm busy right now.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has joined you in your quest.
Good.
It has been a good sport, but it has now come the time for you to go home and meditate on your accomplishments.
We've had a good time.

[Root.GetTitledFirstName],

I feel tired from all this aimless slaughter and have come to the decision of leaving this host. When you'll receive this message I'll be long gone and on my way home.

Good hunting
[From.GetTitledName]
Bah, spineless scum.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has decided to put an end to your Quest. The Blood Dragons, satiated with blood and wantom slaughter, finally return to their hold.
We've had a good time.
With [From.GetTitledFirstName] dead, the Blood Quest is without a leader. One by one, the knights disband, returning to their hold.
It was good while it lasted.
With [From.GetTitledFirstName] captured and beyond reach, the Blood Quest is without a leader. One by one, the knights disband, returning to their hold.
It was good while it lasted.
Do you wish to remain in this land, or venture forth?
There's still much to be killed here.
Yes, let us ride away.
Where would you like to ride your knights?
North.
East.
West.
South.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has decided to move the Blood Quest in the old Imperial lands, hoping for the vast armies and the relentless Witch Hunters to put up a worthy challenge to your blades.
We ride in death.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has decided to move the Blood Quest in the restless Border Princedoms. The countless armies of petty warlords and greenskin savages should provide a good sport for all of you.
We ride in death.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has decided to move the Blood Quest to the snowy plains of Kislev, hoping to track down some of the northern great beasts or find good sport in one of the nomadic tribes roaming the borders.
We ride in death.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has decided to move the Blood Quest to Bretonnia. The fierce and fearless knights of the Lady are sure to put up a worthy challenge to the Knights of Abhorash.
We ride in death.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has decided to move the Blood Quest to the southern realms of Myrmidia. These warm plains scourged by discontented peasants and petty Princes could hold a proper challenge for all of you.
We ride in death.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has decided to move the Blood Quest to the ancient borders of Strygos. This barren wasteland scourged by greenskins and other pathetic creatures will crumble under your hooves.
We ride in death.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has decided to move the Blood Quest to Araby, a land of mystics, scourging hot sun and vast deserts.
We ride in death.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has decided to move the Blood Quest to the mysterious lands of Nehekhara, the ancestral home of all Vampires. Once more, the descendants of Lahmia will fight against the rotting corpses of Khemri.
We ride in death.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has decided to move the Blood Quest to cold shores of Norsca, riddled with hordes of superstitious and warmongering barbarians.
We ride in death.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has decided to lead the host beneath the ground, exploring the long-abandoned underground tunnels of the Dwarfs.
We ride in death.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has decided to lead the host in the far East, exploring the goblin-riddled plains known as Darklands, where only the merciless fist of the Dawi Zharr stands against unfettered anarchy and destruction.
We ride in death.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has decided to lead the host in the ancestral homeland of the Elves, Ulthuan. The elusive island, protected by ancient spells and defended by skilled elven warriors is sure to put up a fearsome fight against your incursion.
We ride in death.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has decided to lead the host in the deadly and poisonous jungles of Lustria. All sorts of exotic and dangerous creatures crawl under the tight leaves of this ancient land, each would make an excellent game for any of you.
We ride in death.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has decided to lead the host to the Land of the Chill, home to the cruel Dark Elves. Skilled in magic and murder, the Druchii are certain to be a great challenge for your blades.
We ride in death.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has decided to lead the host to the intricate and mysterious forest of Athel Loren. Strange and unknowable creatures hide between those ancient trees and the elusive Wood Elves are known to fiercely defend them.
We ride in death.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has decided to lead the host to the ultimate challenge and ride into the Polar Wastes themselves, where the stuff of Chaos pours freely into reality and it's given claws and hunger.
We ride in death.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has decided to lead the host oversea, challenging the great ocean to reach strange and new challenge for you to meet.
We soar in death.

There was no doubt about it from hours before you finally sight the warband in the distance: greenskins. Their stench filled your blackened lungs from miles away. There's hardly any test of resolution against a bloodless foe, but they should at least put up a decent fight for your host.
Let's prepare for battle!
We'll ride around, they're not worth it.
Your leader has caught the scent of a greenskin band and decided to engage them. There's hardly any test of resolution against a bloodless foe, but they should at least put up a decent fight.
I'll partake in this skirmish.
This is beneath me.

The greenskins are still far away, you're quite certain their dim senses have yet to allow them to perceive you. The orcs and goblins are marching in the distance, moving from a hill towards your host and outnumber you greatly, but their brute force should be no match for your knights' skill and determination.
I shall fly and lead a strike on them from above.
We can lure them down before attacking and half their advantage.
We will flank them and crush them from the sides.
We will charge them in a frontal assault.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] calls you and the other knights for an aeral assault on the greenskins. You spur your winged steed, following [From.GetHerHis] lead. You fall down upon the unsuspecting orcs, trampling and slashing greenskins left and right.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] calls some of the knights for an aeral assault on the greenskins. As for you and the other land-bound knights, you have to join the fray later on, charging the greenskins as they are caught by surprise from above.
Die, foul creatures!

You fly off with some of the nights, while the others await down for the signal. Soaring beyond the clouds, with sunlight boiling over your stealplate, you dive down onto the greenskins, trampling them and slashing their stiff flesh.
Your end has come!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] sends you with half of the knights ahead to lure the greenskins down. It's not hard to taunt the beasts into charging down the hill. Once they lose their momentum, [From.GetFirstName] springs the ambush, charging out of the slope as you turn to face the savages as well, along with the rest of your group.
Stupid savages, your end is nigh!

You send half of the host ahead, taunting the orcs to charge down the hill while you find cover behind a slope. It's not hard for the others to taunt them in a charge and once the greenskins have lost their momentum, you come out of your hiding spot, leading an assault from behind them.
Stupid savages, your end is nigh!

[From.GetTitledFirstName]divides the host, ordering a charge from the sides, to flank and crush the pathetic greenskins. The orcs spot you as you ride over the hill, roaring in anticipation for the fight, carelessly running towards both parties.
Mindless beasts, die!

You divide the host, ordering a charge from the sides, to flank and crush the pathetic greenskins. The orcs spot you as you ride over the hill, roaring in anticipation for the fight, carelessly running towards both parties.
Mindless beasts, die!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] shouts, calling for a frontal charge against the greenskin foe. You spur your steed uphill, quickly gaining thrust alongside the other knights and smashing into the gleeful horde of orcs and goblins.
DIE!!

You shout, calling for a frontal charge against the greenskin foe. You spur your steed uphill, quickly gaining thrust alongside the other knights and smashing into the gleeful horde of orcs and goblins.
DIE!!

Dozens of orcs fall before the greenskin's thirst for battle is overcome by their cowardice. The broken remnants of the warband flee back towards the hill, trying to escape the cold steel of your lances and swords.
Pursue them, wipe that pathetic scum from the face of the Earth!
Pursue and capture those wreck for our amusement.
Let the weak flee before our might! We're done here.

One after the other, you cut down the pitiful greenskins, but their numbers and determination are too great: the savages keep on fighting, slowly turning the tide. Finally, your steed falls over, cut down by dozen of goblins and a huge orc bears his hammer down upon your face.
No!!

Dozens of orcs fall before the greenskin's thirst for battle is overcome by their cowardice. The broken remnants of the warband flee back towards the hill, trying to escape the cold steel of your lances and swords. [From.GetFirstName] finally declares victory, standing upon their broken carcasses.
Yahh!
You knights have an easy time reaching and cutting down the remainder of the warband. Their heads roll down the hill, cementing your ultimate victory over this foe.
None stands in the way of the Blood Dragons!
Despite their zeal, your knights can only take some of the cowards' lives before the orcs finally disappear in a nearby wood.
Pests.

Once the  survivors are rounded up, you spend a couple of hours having your fun torturing a few. A couple of them, perhaps believing a purpose to be in your entertainment, shout the name of some stashed loot nearby.
Deluded fools. Still, no reason to let it waste.
Just like moths circling towards the light, a band of ghouls and minor undead has shambled its way to your dominion, instinctively seeking the guide of an aristocrat of the night such as yourself.
More servants are always welcome.
Those revolting carcasses are beneath my needs.
You've waited too long. The adventurers and nomadic Strygan tribes gathered under your banner have slowly lost interest and left, leaving you with too little troops to attempt the reconquest.

You've waited too long. The shambling bands of ghouls gathered under your will have devolved into petty infighting out of starvation, tearing each other apart to the point you have too little troops to attempt an invasion.
Next time... next time...
A great caravan comes into your capital, led by several warriors of the Badlands who heard of your plans and have decided to join you on your quest for your old homeland.
Slowly but surely a great deal of ghouls has started to flock the lands over your cove, lured by the silent call they cannot resist.
Come.

Your name is well remembered by the old aristocrats of Strygos and, albeit your bloodline is by nature reclusive, your renown was enough to lead another Strigoi to your cove, ready to pledge allegiance to you and follow you in your conquest.

Your name is well remembered by the old aristocrats of Strygos and, albeit your bloodline is by nature reclusive, your renown was enough to lead another Strigoi to your cove, ready to pledge allegiance to you and follow you in your conquest.
Welcome, brother.
Little by little, warriors and adventurers have come to your capital, eagerly awaiting for the war to reclaim their ancestors's homeland.
Little by little, the ghouls and Strigany come to you, flocking your land and awaiting your command to march against the usurpers of your ancestral realm.
Good.

You never doubted it, you knew this day would have come, you knew you would have been the one to reclaim Strygos. With the core regions firmly under your control, nobody can deny your great empire is nearly restored. The hordes of savage greenskins and the pitiful armies of the mortals or the trickery of the accursed Lahmians could do nothing but slow down the inevitable.\n\n Strygos has returned to life, with you as its rightful monarch.
I am victorious!

Only legends talk about the wonders and the greatness of old Strygos. Never you could have dreamed one such as yourself could restore the realm of the immortals. And yet, here you are, holding the power once kept by the Tomb Princes, now wrestled by your hand from the savage greenskins.\n\n Strygos has risen once more.
A new age starts for our people!

Despite your trickery and plots, the pitiful humans descendants of the old Strygos have reclaimed their homeland, one of them even having the gall to call [From.GetHerHim]self King of that accursed and misforgotten realm.

For millennia the Lahmians has hindered and hunted down the pathetic remnants of Ushoran's bloodline and yet the Strigoi have finally prevailed: a perveted flesh-eater rules over the Badlands, fancying [From.GetHerHim]self monarch of Strygos. Never were you so angered and embarassed at your failure.
Curse them all!

You had long dreamed for this moment, yet the resurgence of Strygos couldn't have come from a more unexpected source: it was not one of Ushoran's bloodline, but a humble mortal, a wandering Strigany, to restore the old realm.

You had long dreamed for this moment and although you'd have wished to be the one restoring Strygos, you can find solance knowing the blood of Ushoran reigns once more in Morukain, demanding the proper respect over all the Badlands.
I wish to join this Strygos reborn.
This is but another fleeting dream.

A great caravan of Strigany has come to the gates of your capital. Although the gypsies wear strange clothes and talk a strange dialect, they seem quiet and well-intentioned. They bring weird craft and exotic spices from afar to be sold within your walls.
They are welcome.
I don't want their kind here.
[FromFrom.GetFirstName] has returned empty-handed from the expedition. It appears none of the lands [FromFrom.GetSheHe] visited would welcome Strigany merchants.
Drats.

Esteemed [Root.GetTitledFirstName],

I bring good tidings from [From.Location.GetName], we've been accepted by the locals and started selling our wares. 

I've sent some of our profit along with this missive
[FromFrom.GetTitledName]
Good.
Your merchants have sold lots of wares and made good profit this season. You will be greatly welcomed as you return to your liege.
Let's ride home, friends.

Esteemed [Root.GetTitledFirstName],

I bring you great wealth and craft [From.Location.GetName], where our merchants have sold most of our products this season. 

As customary, I bring forth your share of the profits
[From.GetTitledName]
Good. Keep travelling there.
This will be enough for that place. I want you here.
The Strigany merchants have packed their tents and removed themselves from your capital, probably for good this time.
It was about time.
Your merchants have sold some wares and made a decent profit this season. You will be welcomed as you return to your liege.
Let's ride home, friends.

Esteemed [Root.GetTitledFirstName],

I bring you wealth and craft [From.Location.GetName], where our merchants have sold a good part of our products this season. 

As customary, I bring forth your share of the profits
[From.GetTitledName]
Good. Keep travelling there.
This will be enough for that place. I want you here.
There has been a series of accidents and misunderstanding earning you the hate of the locals. You've had therefore not make good profit this season.
Drats.

There's been some miscontent within your capital in the past few months. The locals seem to have grown tired of the Strigany wandering about their homes, taking up their places in the market and, according to some reports, performing dark rituals in the night.
Those gypsies are nothing but trouble.

Esteemed [Root.GetTitledFirstName],

I regret to inform you our travel to [From.Location.GetName] has not been as successful as expected. A series of accidents and misunderstandings have earned us the hate of the locals, making it difficult for our merchants to sell their wares. 

Perhaps it might be better to change our destination for the next season
[From.GetTitledName]
No, keep travelling there. They'll get used to us.
A good suggestion. Stay here for now.
The bigotry and hate of the locals drove them to openly attack your merchants. You are forced to return home without any of your products sold.
Curses.

The people in the capital have grown tired of the Strigany. Made fearful by their strange customs and dark rituals, they've risen up and openly attacked the merchants, driving them away from your city.
Probably it's for the best...

Esteemed [Root.GetTitledFirstName],

I regret to inform you our travel to [From.Location.GetName] has been ill-fated. The locals, enflamed by our mere appearance, have driven us out of the city in a few days, preventing us from selling any of our wares. 

We are no longer welcomed in this realm for some time,
[From.GetTitledName]
That's inconvenient.
Your great skills as a leader and a merchant has led your caravan to build a proper colony in these lands.
Great!

Your leniency in the past years might have been ill-advised. The community of Strigany has become so large to have claimed some of your lands, building a stable tribe there from which their caravans pass through each season.
That's... not something I ordered.

Esteemed [Root.GetTitledFirstName],

Our perseverance has paid off. No longer we are mere travellers in [From.Location.GetName] a stable Strygan outpost has been built in the past years as more of our people flocked in to share in our profits.

We pledge ourselves under your protection as I take charge of this post, with your blessing,
[From.GetTitledName]
Great news indeed.
With Strygos reformed, you have the chance to restore the old Kingdom to its true glory. Should you push for the return of the old laws and customs?
Yes, Strygos shall be as it were.
No, this is a new Kingdom.
The Strigany in [Root.GetName] have slowly settled permanently in their old lands, taking the old customs of their forefathers.
Good.
More Strigany are flocking every month in [Root.GetName], colonizing once more their ancestral homeland.
Good.
Your minions have broken the defenses of [From.GetName]. Even now they move forward to round up the local population. What should be done with the mortals?
Kill them all. Destroy everything.
They'll make good subjects.
I do not care about these.
[From.GetFirstName] has sent [From.GetHerHis] vile minions to destroy the province of [FromFrom.GetName], leaving nothing but tainted rubble, marked with the repulsive stench of undeath.
Blasted abominations!
[From.GetFirstName] has sent [From.GetHerHis] vile minions to destroy the province of [FromFrom.GetName], kidnapping dozens of families to be subjected to [From.GetHerHis] vile experiments.
Blasted abominations!
[From.GetFirstName] has sent [From.GetHerHis] vile minions to destroy the province of [FromFrom.GetName], many of the survivors of the attack are already flocking your gates.
Blasted abominations!
You have some spare subjects in your dungeons. How would you employ them?
They are good samples for my personal studies.
They can be repurposed to serve me forever.
Keep them there for now.

As the blood of the last subject runs dry, you have concluded one of the most successful sessions of study you've had in quite some time. Experimenting on the pitiful mortals has given you a deeper understanding of the dark art of Nagash.
Another good night of work.

Subject after subject, you twist and break the bodies and souls of your victims, looking at their entrails, recording the pitch of their screams, trying and dispelling incantations one after the other. In the end, you feel satisifed with your results.
Another good night of work.

Subject after subject, you twist and break the bodies and souls of your victims, looking at their entrails, recording the pitch of their screams, trying and dispelling incantations one after the other. The results might not be as good as you hoped for, but you're still adequately satisfied with yourself.
Another good night of work.

Subject after subject, you twist and break the bodies and souls of your victims, looking at their entrails, recording the pitch of their screams, trying and dispelling incantations one after the other. Sadly, this batch of mortals was not as enlightening as one would have hoped and your night ends in mild frustration.
Next time will be better.

Once you're done with them, the resulting minions have no resemblance to the subjects they once were. Such was the power and the skill you put on your work, they've been utterly transformed into loyal and terrifying creatures of the night.
Magnificent.

You've had to discard several damaged subjects, but those who survived have now no resemblance to the subjects they once were. Such was the power and the skill you put on your work, they've been utterly transformed into loyal and terrifying creatures of the night.
Magnificent.

Your original draft might have been too ambitious or, more likely, your subjects defective. The result of your experiment was a pack of ravenous and gibberish humanoids, still useful in a way, but nothing as grand and terrifying as you hoped for.
Next time.

Your original draft might have been too ambitious or, more likely, your subjects defective. None of them managed to stay alive until the end. They'll at least be decent undead slaves, if nothing else.
Better than nothing.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has sent some of [From.GetHerHis] minions pleading for you to put your vast magical expertise into [From.GetHerHis] temporary employ and craft a magic item for [From.GetHerHim].
Very well.
I do not make trinckets for ones such as you.
[From.GetFirstName] has decided it would not be in [From.GetHerHis] best interest to craft a magic item for you.
Drats.
You've chosen as your target one of the greatest servants of Khorne, a terrible creature moulded for war. A Daemon Prince will be a dangerous and terrible foe to fight.

You've chosen as your target one of the greatest servants of Nurgle, a gelatinous blob of pestilence and decay, corrupting anything that touches. A Daemon Prince will be a dangerous and terrible foe to fight.
You've chosen as your target one of the greatest servants of Slaanesh, an eerie and depraved creature, filled with cruelty and desire. A Daemon Prince will be a dangerous and terrible foe to fight.

You've chosen as your target one of the greatest servants of Tzeentch, a shapeshifting incomprehensible being, filled with the destructive power of Chaos. A Daemon Prince will be a dangerous and terrible foe to fight.

You've chosen as your target one of the mysterious wood spirits who rest in the twilight glades of Athel Loren. The forest itself will be a guardian to the creature, alongside any living thing around it.

You've chosen as your target one of the mysterious wood spirits who rest in the twilight glades of Athel Loren. The forest itself will be a guardian to the creature, alongside any living thing around it.
You've chosen as your target one of the ancient sleeping rulers of the Lizardmen, said to wield the oldest and most powerful form of magic, learned directly from the Old Ones.

You've chosen as your target one of the old vampires. Unlike the Carsteins and their ilk, this creature lurks alone in the shadows, hidden by traps, magic and mindless servants, barely ever seeing the living.

You've chosen as your target one of the Princes of Darkness. Despite their many mundane weaknesses, vampires are a dangerous opponent, infused by unnatural senses and strength and gifted with natural dark magic. Killing one won't be easy.
I will fell the monster myself.
I will search for somebody competent for this quest.
I'll bide my time for now.
You've prepared an expedition to kill your target, but still need a skilled fighter to lead it.
I'll send my Marshal.
A Witch Hunter is what we need.
One of our wizards will succeed.
I'd better wait some more first...

My most trusted friend,
 I hereby summon you to embark on a quest to fell a vile creature troubling my sleep. Should you accept and succeed, you will earn my eternal gratitude.

 [From.GetTitledFirstName]
I'll go at once!
Hum... no thanks.

[Root.GetTitledFirstName]
 I am honored by your invitation. I will depart at once to rid the world of this creature.

Best regards,
 [Root.GetTitledFirstName]
Good, now it's out of my hands.

I'm sorry to inform you a grave business has come up in my household, requiring my immediate attention. I am therefore obliged to decline your prestigious invitation.

Regards
 [Root.GetTitledFirstName]
I'll have to wait some more...
The great hall of the Daemon Prince of Khorne, your target, is a brass palace, stained with blood and decorated with thousands of skulls and bones from its many victims. How should you approach it?
The great hall of the Daemon Prince of Nurgle, your target, is a desolate sanctuary, wrapped in a sickly yellowish miasma, charged with countless diseases. How should you approach it?
The great hall of the Daemon Prince of Slaanesh, your target, is a marvelous palace, decorated with gold and silver and scattered sharp mirrors. How should you approach it?
The great hall of the Daemon Prince of Tzeentch, your target, is weird and alien tower, rising into impossible angles, shifting at each bling of your eyes. How should you approach it?

You've reached the great forest of magic. Your sources and trackers would lead you to believe your quarry, the wood spirit, is nearby, although it is hard to tell within the everchanging landscape of Loren.

You've reached the great forest of magic. Your sources and trackers would lead you to believe your quarry, the wood spirit, is nearby, although it is hard to tell within the everchanging landscape of Loren.

You've reached the great piramid of your target, the ancient Slann. The creature is likely sleeping within, but there is no telling what traps and spells it has wrapped around the building. Or how many Skinks are guarding it.
You've reached the dark cove of the ancient vampire you hunt for. The green moon is clouded and only a few stars glitter the nightsky. Perhaps this might not be the right moment to push forward.
You've reached the gloomy palace of the vampire you seek to destroy. It is a clouded night and you can hear the crackling sound of the undead's bones in the courtyard. How should you proceed?
My magic shall protect us and lead inside undetected.
We wait for dawn. Then sneak in.
We sneak in, checking for traps.
Charge!
Intruders have been found sneaking inside your very lair. They're attempt to pass unnoticed has failed, but they're still pushing forward, likely to reach your room.
I shall unleash fire and death upon them.
I must find a safe place from the sun!
Go forth, my minions, slaughter the intruders!
Intruders are assaulting your lair. They've surpassed the outer defences and are rushing inside towards your location.
I must find a safe place from the sun!
Go forth, my minions, slaughter the intruders!
[From.GetFirstName] has unleashed [From.GetHerHis] deadly power and burned you and your companions to a crisp. Your quest ends here.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] was not up to the challenge, it seems. You've received news of [From.GetHerHis] death.
I'll have to wait for another chance.
[From.GetFirstName] has unleashed [From.GetHerHis] deadly power to try and burn you and your companions alive. You've barely survived, but not without grievous injuries.
Hnnnmpf..!

The hellhounds of the Daemon Prince are after your squad, yelling and growling, their echoes reverbering on the metallic walls of the sanctuary. You can see the Daemon awaiting, swords at hand, on its throne, but you must get through its minions first.

Nurglings crawls all over your bodies, trying to sink their infective teeth in your flesh, as you slowly advance in the miasmic swamp. It is only after a while you realize the hill ahead of you is really the Daemon Prince of Nurgle, awaiting to embrace you.

Demented sycophants hurl themselves at you, piercing and pulling your skin with hooks and chains. You've slowly made your way through the labyrintine palace, but have yet to reach the depraved servant of Slaanesh.

The very floor and walls shift at your steps, trying to grab and cut you and your followers in pieces. You feel you're closer to the center of madness, the Daemon Prince of Tzeentch, but have yet to pierce through its spells and illusions.

The very floor and walls shift at your steps, trying to grab and cut you and your followers in pieces. You feel you're closer to the center of madness, the Daemon Prince of Tzeentch, but have yet to pierce through its spells and illusions.
The forest has risen against you. Dryads and saplings slow your advance towards the Spirit's glade, while hidden Asrai target you from afar.
Every step upwards a new trap triggers, a new spell falls down upon your men, cutting down your numbers. Yet, your evermore closer to the top, where the Slann awaits in sleep.
The hordes of ghouls and other undead monstrosities are blocking your path downards, but you still keep fighting through, knowing every fallen rotten corpse is a step closer to your quarry.
The enthralled guards and undead minions of the vampire have come to block your way. You must fight your way through the palace to reach your quarry.
Forward!
Your rush towards your target has not been successfull. You're the last to fall. When you awake, your corpse has been thrown outside. Albeith you've risen again, your mission has failed.
I'll have revenge!
Your rush towards your target has not been successfull. You're the last to fall, marking the end of your quest.
You've made your way through the obstacles put in your way by your quarry, now it's time to fell the beast itself and be done with it.
Face me, creature!

The Chaos God of War and Violence will have another reason to distaste magic today. Thanks to your spells, you've managed to foil the outer defences of the Daemon Prince and appeared right in its sanctum, before it.
With your magic you've surpassed undetected the halo of sickness and crawling horrors defending the sanctuary of the Nurglite Prince and are now before it, ready to kill the monster.
Your magic led you through the halls of torture and debauchery of the Slaaneshi Prince undetected. You finally appear before the creature, in the middle of its oscene activities, ready to fight it.
Not even the Changer of Ways could unshroud your veil as you fluctuated through the halls of his favourite servant and reached the sanctum of the Daemon Prince without alerting the creature.
Not even the Changer of Ways could unshroud your veil as you fluctuated through the halls of his favourite servant and reached the sanctum of the Daemon Prince without alerting the creature.
The depths of Athel Loren have often confounded travellers, but putting magic against magic allowed you to easily reach the hiding place of the forest spirit.

The magic of the Old Ones is not something easy to pass through, yet today you've achieved such a feat, reaching unscathed the top of the piramid. The Slann is inside, fluctuating atop the ground, in his eternal sleep.

Through your spells, you've managed to pass undetected the hordes of undead protecting your quarry's tomb and are now upon the rotten body of the ancient vampire, staring at you with empty eyes from its resting place.

Through your spells, you've managed to pass undetected the guards and traps of the vampire, reaching undetected its bedroom. Now you are now upon the pale body of your target, staring at you with empty eyes from its resting place.
*Attempt Assassination*
*Attack the monster*
Through care and cunning, you've managed to foil the outer defences of the Daemon Prince and appeared right in its sanctum, before it.
Through care and cunning, you've surpassed undetected the halo of sickness and crawling horrors defending the sanctuary of the Nurglite Prince and are now before it, ready to kill the monster.

Your care and cunning led you through the halls of torture and debauchery of the Slaaneshi Prince undetected. You finally appear before the creature, in the middle of its oscene activities, ready to fight it.
Without need for magic, you managed to sneak through the halls of the Daemon Prince and reached the sanctum of the Daemon Prince without alerting the creature.
Without need for magic, you managed to sneak through the halls of the Daemon Prince and reached the sanctum of the Daemon Prince without alerting the creature.
The depths of Athel Loren have often confounded travellers, but a keen mind was all you needed to reach the hiding tree of your quarry.
The magic of the Old Ones is not something easy to pass through, yet you've managed to do so, without even need for magic. The Slann is inside, fluctuating atop the ground, in his eternal sleep.

Through your care and cunning, you've managed to pass undetected the hordes of undead protecting your quarry's tomb and are now upon the rotten body of the ancient vampire, staring at you with empty eyes from its resting place.

Through your care and cunning, you've managed to pass undetected the guards and traps of the vampire, reaching undetected its bedroom. Now you are now upon the pale body of your target, staring at you with empty eyes from its resting place.
*Attempt Assassination*
*Attack the monster*
Through care and cunning, you've managed to foil the outer defences of the Daemon Prince and appeared right in its sanctum, before it.
Through care and cunning, you've surpassed undetected the halo of sickness and crawling horrors defending the sanctuary of the Nurglite Prince and are now before it, ready to kill the monster.

Your care and cunning led you through the halls of torture and debauchery of the Slaaneshi Prince undetected. You finally appear before the creature, in the middle of its oscene activities, ready to fight it.
Without need for magic, you managed to sneak through the halls of the Daemon Prince and reached the sanctum of the Daemon Prince without alerting the creature.
Without need for magic, you managed to sneak through the halls of the Daemon Prince and reached the sanctum of the Daemon Prince without alerting the creature.
The depths of Athel Loren have often confounded travellers, but a keen mind was all you needed to reach the hiding tree of your quarry.
The magic of the Old Ones is not something easy to pass through, yet you've managed to do so, without even need for magic. The Slann is inside, fluctuating atop the ground, in his eternal sleep.
Through your care and cunning, you've managed to pass undetected the hordes of undead protecting your quarry's tomb and reaching undetected its rooms.
Through your care and cunning, you've managed to pass undetected the guards and traps of the vampire, reaching undetected its rooms.
*Attempt Assassination*
*Attack the monster*
The bloated frog whimpers as you extract your blade from its throat one last time, finally falling down to touch the ground and wither like a disseccated leaf.
The old vampire gives out a silent scream as you plunge the stake in its heart, trapping the creature, and cut its head off with your blade. You put the foul corpse on fire and finally leave.
The vampire gives out a silent scream as you plunge the stake in its heart, trapping the creature, and cut its head off with your blade. You put the foul corpse on fire and finally leave.
It is done.

As you're about to strike the sleeping monster, the creature wakes up, staying your hand. You struggle for a while, but in the end are overcome. When you awake, you're outside the lair, amongst the corpses of your comrades. You might live again, but your quest has failed.
I'll have revenge!
As you're about to strike the sleeping monster, the creature wakes up, staying your hand. You struggle for a while, but in the end are overcome. Your quest has ended.
It is all in but an instant. You awake from your sleep as your life is violently stripped away by a group of monster hunters.
Graaahhh!!
The beast is dead. You can rest easy now, knowing its foul presence no longer threatens you.
Finally!
The Daemon Prince strikes at you, holding a firey whip in a hand and a screaming sword in the other, taunting and insulting each of you. The time has come for the final fight.

The Daemon Prince stands over you, smiling and protrunding its arms, to welcome you in its pestilential embrace. Its mere stench is enough to make some of your comrades puke. The time has come for the final fight.
The Daemon Prince laughs and leaps at you, fangs and claws ahead, trying to reach your eyes and face.. The time has come for the final fight.
The Daemon Prince screeches and points you with its twisted claw, starting to chant a deadly spell. The time has come for the final fight.
The Daemon Prince screeches and points you with its twisted claw, starting to chant a deadly spell. The time has come for the final fight.
The forest spirit finally unshackled from its tree, charges towards you, trampling anything that stands in its path, mad with anger. The time has come for the final fight.

The Slann opens its bulbous eyes, raising its skeletrical arms to form the first magical wards in the air as it prepares to unleash the wrath of the Old Ones upon you. The time has come for the final fight.
The old vampire leaps at you, screeching and growling, felling one of your fighters with unnatural speed and moving forward to slaughter the rest of you. The time has come for the final fight.
The vampire leaps at you, screeching and growling, felling one of your fighters with unnatural speed and moving forward to slaughter the rest of you. The time has come for the final fight.
I will destroy you!

With an explosion of blood and splinters the Daemon Prince of Khorne is finally destroyed. Its disembowed skeleton screams and keeps on fighting still for a while, enveloped in a dark unnatural fire, until it consumes itself entirely, leaving no trace of the wicked creature.

Cut from a thousand wounds, the bloated body of the Nurglite Prince starts flushing out a torrent of pus and mucus, slowly crumbling on itself. You finally manage to crawl on its back and reach the head of the daemon, plunging your blade within its mouth. The Daemon Prince liquifies, living nothing but a pool of toxic waste beneath it.

With many of its arms and spines maimed, the Daemon Prince of Slaanesh is finally cornered. The survivors of your squad plunge their spears into its head and chest, disregarding its chuckled and incessant moaning, until the creature finally turns into porcelain and falls into pieces.

The more it becomes desperate and hurt, the more the Daemon Prince uses its magic to teleport to a safer place within the hall, always pursued by your comrades. One last time, you strike at it while it's still in the middle of the spell and the creature miscasts, imploding in a shower of purple feathers and white flames.

The more it becomes desperate and hurt, the more the Daemon Prince uses its magic to teleport to a safer place within the hall, always pursued by your comrades. One last time, you strike at it while it's still in the middle of the spell and the creature miscasts, imploding in a shower of purple feathers and white flames.
Hacked down piece by piece, the forest spirit finally crumbles down with one last saddened moan. You order your men to keep on hacking, until every piece of it has been reduced to splinters.
With one final whimper, the Slann splatters on the walls of the piramid, thorn apart by the Winds of Magic in its final attempt to defend itself from you.

The monstrous vampire falls back, trying to flee in a cloud of fog, deadly injured by your fighters, but you're quicker than the creature and manage to stop it by stabbing its heart. Now immobilized, the vampire is easily disposed of by the rest of you.

The vampire falls back, trying to flee in a cloud of fog, deadly injured by your fighters, but you're quicker than the creature and manage to stop it by stabbing its heart. Now immobilized, the vampire is easily disposed of by the rest of you.
Victory!

One by one your companions are ripped into shreds by your foe. The monster mercilessly kills you, tossing away your remains. When you awake, you are outside the creature's lair. You might live again, but you've failed your quest.
I will have revenge!
One by one your companions are ripped into shreds by your foe. The monster mercilessly kills you, tossing away your remains. Your quest is over.
The adventurers who infiltrated your lair have cornered you. You fight savagely against them, but it is of no avail. In the end, their leader gives the final strike which kills you.
Naaaannhh!!!
The adventurers who infiltrated your lair finally come to face you directly, they are fierce, but they could do nothing against a creature such as yourself and are obliterated one by one.
Ah!
Every once in a century, when the stars are aligned, the Spawning Pools give birth to just one Skink, gifted with the power of the Ancients. This is such a day.
Praissse the Creatorsss!

The Great Plan must be achieved.
 Your behavior is not in line with the stars, we must realign the efforts of this city-temple to the will of the gods. Acknowledge your defective actions and relinquish the leadership of this city.
 If you persist in this faulty behavior, we will be forced to assume direct control of all your assets by force.

 The Old Ones are wise in all things
I admit my faultsss...
You are defffective!

The Great Plan must be achieved.
 With your petty request for illegittimate power, you've revealed clear failings within your soul. I must therefore act to defend the interests of the Mage-Priests in their absence by subduing this menace within our midst.
 You must be submitted and corrected,
 for the glory of the Old Ones!
The realignment will occur, regardlessss!

The Great Plan must be achieved.
 I recognize the fault within my taught and understand my defective soul might have compromise the will of our Creators. I therefore relinquish my task unto you and submit for re-education.

 Praised be the Old Ones.
Now I will realign uss to the will of the godsss.

[From.GetTitledName] has recognized [From.GetHerHis] failings in understanding the will of the Old Ones and agreed to allow us to assume [From.GetHerHis] task to realign our efforts with the gods' will. Your valuable support in this process will be remembered by the Creators once they return to this world.\n\nPraise be the Old Ones
Praissse the Creatorsss!
[From.GetTitledName] has aknowledged [From.GetHerHis] defective thoughts and relinquished lead of this city-temple to a more competent Skink.
I sssee...

Your long search for ancient artifacts on behalf of your superior has almost cost you your life today, when you've been attacked by a pack of young wild naggaronts, barely escaping along your entourage of Sauri.
All ssacrificess are worthy on behalf of the Old Onesss...
All ssacrificess are worthy on behalf of the Old Onesss...

Old Ones preserve us,
 on our search, we've been caught by the wild beasts which are sacred to our progenitors, but still do not recognize our task in their mindless souls.
 My body has been temporarely incapacitated, but I shall soon retake my duties.

 The Old Ones are wise in their design
I sssee...

 on our search, we've been caught by the wild beasts which are sacred to our progenitors, but still do not recognize our task in their mindless souls.

By the will of the Old Ones, your hard search has finally given its result: you've found a fragment of one of the ancient tablets of the Creators, whose translation will allow the Lizardmen to better fulfill their ultimate task.
Praissse the Old Onesss!
By the will of the Old Ones, your Chief Explorer has found a fragment of one of the ancient tablets of the Creators, whose translation will allow the Lizardmen to better fulfill their ultimate task.
Praissse the Old Onesss!
You've defeated the warriors of [From.GetName]. According to the old rituals, all of the prisoners caught fighting in this land are elegible to be worthy sacrifices to the Old Ones.
Pillage all! Take everything!
We will take only the sacrifices.
These are not worthy, move on.
[From.GetFirstName] has raided the province of [FromFrom.GetName], snatching many of the warriors and civilians and leaving nothing but a smoking rubble of many villages.
Monstrous savages!

Monstrous savages!
